jobDescription: Overview Oversees the timely and accurate conversion of high complexity 401(k) plans to Paychex. Provides advanced service to clients and designated Financial Advisors by acting as the sole service point of contact for clients during their conversion and by contacting both clients and Financial Advisors on a regular basis during the conversion of their plan to Paychex. Responsibilities Travels to on-site client visits as necessary to build and strengthen relationships with HRS Sales, Financial Advisors, CPAs, Attorneys and clients and to assist clients with the conversion of their plan to Paychex. Partners with HRS Sales and Financial Advisors to review client/prospect existing 401(k) plan documents and creation of client plan election information with Paychex. Develops and maintains knowledge of Paychex and industry plan structures, services and specific conversion processes in order to serve as a department expert on assigned accounts and to provide an exceptionally high level of client service during the conversion process. Works with Conversions staff to ensure that all conversion deadlines are met by Paychex during the conversion process. Contacts plan trustees and designated Financial Advisors on a weekly basis during the conversion of their plan to ensure clear expectations and client satisfaction. Executes outbound communication of setup status to clients, internal Paychex personnel and Financial Advisors following client calls and at points necessary to ensure deadlines are met and that expectations are clear. Schedules and conducts initial technical plan setup calls between plan trustees, prior record-keepers and Paychex conversion specialists to assist with facilitating the conversion process. Schedules Financial Advisors and other members of Paychex on calls as necessary. Performs follow up with clients and Financial Advisors on communication necessary to liquidate assets from prior administrator. Answers advanced client and Financial Advisor questions regarding plan design, the conversion process and our ongoing service model to ensure all issues are resolved. Answers conversion inquiries from clients, sales, field operations, Financial Advisors, CPAs, auditors, attorneys, prior record keepers and other HRS personnel to ensure all issues are resolved. Facilitates review of processes, procedures and systems and initiates requests for enhancements or business needs, to allow for better service to be provided to our clients in a quick and efficient manner. Qualifications Client Service or Account Management - 6 years 401(k) related work experience and product knowledge -2 years Associate's Degree - Preferred

Overview Under a minimal level of guidance and direction, provides customer service for Paychex retirement products. Ensures good customer relations are maintained and customer claims and complaints are resolved fairly, effectively and in accordance with Paychex policies and procedures. Proactively educates and informs clients, and initiates improvements based on client feedback. Has in-depth knowledge of at least one Paychex product. Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Handles accounts with asset levels under $1 million Responsibilities Cultivates strong relationships with clients and internal and external partners to deliver quality service Proactively identifies opportunities to enhance clients' service experience Maintains an advanced working knowledge of multiple Paychex products, as well as industry policies and procedures Identifies and implements opportunities for process improvements Demonstrates advanced skill level with systems and software packages, which may include HRIS, Salesforce, Flex, Core Advanced, and ORS Serves as a mentor for less experienced teammates Documents all interactions and uses the information to improve service Qualifications 401(k) experience - 2 years Client service or account management experience - 2 years Bachelor's Degree - Preferred

Overview To provide business decision support and strategic insight to advance overall operations within the 401(k)/S125 department including customer service delivery, expense controls, and profitability. Responsibilities include working closely with the leadership team to define critical information needs, provide guidance regarding availability of data and capability of systems to meet information and reporting needs, and to lead prioritized departmental process improvement efforts using Lean Six Sigma methodologies. Responsibilities Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and scorecards used by the 401(k)/S125 leadership team to track key metrics including but not limited to client survey data, client loss analyses, and operations processing. Data is used by the 401(k)/S125 leadership team to understand the state of the business and for ongoing decision making. Systems used to produce information includes but is not limited to Salesforce.com, HRIS, Paychex Enterprise Data Warehouse, Crystal Reports, Business Objects, MS Excel, and multiple MS Access databases. Conduct regular and ad-hoc analyses for tactical daily operations, as well as for key project initiatives and strategies. This requires identifying and understanding key issues, strong analytical thinking, the ability to conduct quantitative analysis and develop conclusions based on analysis/research. Possesses knowledge of the business and business processes. Understands how analytical needs support business processes and proactively apply this knowledge to solve business problems. Thinks beyond ad hoc requests to identify patterns that should be addressed by a more holistic solution. Develops collaborative working relationships with all business partners to ensure a high level of utilization of team services for departmental needs. Meets regularly with the 401(k)/S125 Management team to report status of Reporting requests, present analysis results, discuss opportunities for improvements within the operation, and to schedule future engagements. Applies established process improvement methodologies, including Six Sigma and LEAN, to review regularly review operational effectiveness. Specific role includes workshop facilitation, process mapping and decomposition, process redesign, business case development and metrics quantification and analysis, in effort to improve effectiveness and/or increase efficiencies. Communicates the results of process improvement projects and the continued value of business process management to the organization. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Technical experience with databases and data warehousing concept/tools and proven capability to strategically problem-solve using advanced quantitative and analytical skills.

Overview Acts as the primary contact for Strategic Accounts 401(k) clients regarding all retirement products. Responsibilities Acts as the primary contact for Strategic Accounts 401(k) clients regarding all retirement products to ensure consistent quality service. Proactively communicates with client on a quarterly basis regarding status, questions, and time lines. Partners with operational groups to maintain clients' plans. Prepares and reviews client forms prior to delivery to ensure accuracy of product produced. Provides training to explain reports and product features. Develops and maintains knowledge of account structures, services, and specific processes for assigned clients. Reviews plan designs to ensure client satisfaction. Establishes and maintains partnerships with Sales and other internal partners to ensure client needs are met. Communicates with outside parties, including CPAs, Financial Advisors, Attorneys, Auditors, and third-party vendors. Develops and maintains knowledge of IRS and ERISA regulations to provide optimal service and technical guidance regarding plan maintenance and to ensure plan compliance with all regulations. Identifies and coordinates customized client service needs, including plan design and documentation exceptions. Conducts client visits to maintain and strengthen relationships. Conducts web seminar meetings with clients and their employees to encourage maximum employee 401(k) plan participation. Acts as a point of contact for Financial Advisors. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 3 years of experience in Related field. Demonstrates problem solving skills. Demonstrates written communication skills. Strong verbal communication and listening skills. Demonstrates customer service skills. Effective interpersonal skills. Articulate and responsive to colleagues. Ability to build strong customer relationships. Ability to simultaneously handle multiple priorities. Assumes personal responsibility for actions. Demonstrates excellent judgment and decision making skills. Ability to work within tight timeframes and meet strict deadlines. QKA or higher - Preferred Location Specific Compensation Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents: Range minimum: $51,500/yr + bonus Range maximum: $75,000/yr + bonus Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Responsibilities Discover your potential as an Account Executive in our Health and Benefits sales division selling primarily inside the Paychex client base. We are looking for those driven to be successful in a fast-paced, consultative, business to business sales environment. In this role, you will be responsible for expanding the breadth of our services to our Paychex client base thru prospecting and driving revenue to a monthly quota. You must exude our values of integrity and accountability and work with a balance of teamwork and entrepreneurial spirit. To provide direct marketing of Paychex Agency Insurance products and services through effective sales techniques. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers in accordance with the client’s preference on in person or virtual interaction to increase revenue and market share Generates sales revenue to meet or exceed sales quota by contacting existing client base and utilizing effective sales methods to qualify insurance and human resource needs. Applies knowledge of Paychex Agency Insurance Products and Services products to effectively interest clients. Performs insurance needs analysis for clients to provide solutions to insurance and benefit needs. Writes up and processes sales contracts in a professional manner and in accordance with HRS operation guidelines. Performs underwriting of business risks in accordance with insurance carrier guidelines. Additional duties as assigned by management. Life, Accident and Health must be obtained within 60 days of employment. “Be Paychex” with every interaction internally and externally. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in sales.

Overview Sells Paychex Agency Health and Employee Benefits Insurance products and services to new clients and existing Paychex clients. Responsibilities Achieves corporate objectives by individual product line category within the assigned territory. Generates sales revenue and health applications to meet and exceed sales quotas. Achieves technical, competitive and sales skill knowledge by attaining objectives set by the sales management team. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers in accordance with the client’s preference on in person or virtual interaction to increase revenue and market share. Develops internal relationships to assist in increasing the client base. Develops a referral network to assist in increasing the client base. Develops Insurance Carrier relationships to enhance sales and service. Processes sales contracts in a professional manner and in accordance with HRS guidelines. Projecting a positive image in representing the company to clients and the community. Life, Accident and Health must be obtained within 90 days of employment. Achieves corporate objectives by individual product line category within the assigned territory. Generates sales revenue and health applications to meet and exceed sales quota. Achieves technical, competitive and sales skill knowledge by attaining objectives set by the sales management team. Makes calls and visits to present the company's products to clients. Develops internal relationships to assist in increasing the client base. Develops a referral network to assist in increasing the client base. Develops Insurance Carrier relationships to enhance sales and service. Processes sales contracts in a professional manner and in accordance with HRS guidelines. Projecting a positive image in representing the company to clients and the community. Life, Accident and Health must be obtained within 90 days of employment. Qualifications Associate's Degree in Business or related discipline Bachelor's Degree in Business or related discipline - Preferred 2 years of experience in Relevant sales /marketing experience or the equivalent education and experience. Life Accident and Health license Life, Accident and Health must be obtained within 90 days of employment. - Preferred Life Accident and Health license - Required Must live in the WA/OR area

You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs

Responsibilities Discover your potential as an Account Executive in our Human Resource Services sales division selling primarily inside the Paychex client base. We are looking for those driven to be successful in a fast-paced, consultative, business to business sales environment. In this role, you will be responsible for expanding the breadth of our services to our Paychex client base thru prospecting and driving revenue to a monthly quota. You must exude our values of integrity and accountability and work with a balance of teamwork and entrepreneurial spirit. In this role, you will… Maximize your earning potential through salary plus uncapped bonus compensation plan by executing daily sales activities which lead to sales opportunity. Meet and exceed sales quotas through prospecting, qualifying, and onboarding Paychex clients to additional services. Partner with Channel, Major Markets, PEO peer sales representatives to onboard Paychex clients with our additional HR service offerings, the full value of Paychex. With your entrepreneurial drive and strong business acumen, build your business through evaluation of our prospective clients’ human capital management needs. Hone your sales abilities thru our world-class Sales Training. Develop your sales skills and maintain a comprehensive and up-to-date understanding of the Paychex best-in-class product offerings in weekly learning sessions to optimize sales results. “Be Paychex” with every interaction internally and externally. Qualifications The role is a strong fit, if you have… A Desire to Win. You have a positive, resilient, relentless attitude and a strong emotional intelligence which has led to your past successes. A Strong, Consistent Work Ethic. Willing to go above and beyond. Self-directed, adaptable and resourceful. Values which Align to Ours. Our Paychex values weave through all we do here – from company strategy to daily decision making. An Ability to Leverage Technology. The ability to learn and leverage all of our training, presentation and sales tools. Sales Experience. If you know HCM, our sales training program will lead to production quickly. If not, we have one of the best training programs in America (decades running) to give you a strong foundation. Experience in a prospecting/cold calling role is required. Licensing may be required for some sales roles. Bachelor's Degree Preferred

Overview Selling Company's products and services by developing new clients and increasing the client base to increase profits in the Sale of Human Resource Services and PEO Sales organizations. Responsibilities Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers in accordance with the client’s preference on in person or virtual interaction to increase revenue and market share. Scheduling appointments and visiting potential and current referral sources to secure referrals to end users. Prospecting for new clients and new referral sources utilizing the telephone, direct mail, seminars, current client visits, or other local marketing programs directed by Sales management. Analyzing the customer needs and interests, determining which products are appropriate and referring to appropriate party when necessary. Expediting the resolution of customer problems or complaints. Completing and submitting accurate new business paperwork, expense reports and weekly activity reports by agreed upon dates set by Sales management. Projecting a positive image in representing the Corporation to clients and the community. Achieving technical, competitive and sales skills knowledge. Competency is measured by the successful attainment of objectives and performance within the HR Solutions and PEO Sales. May be required to travel outside of geographical territory for purposes of attending Conference, training sessions and/or area Zone meetings. Attend partner meetings to educate on HR Solutions and PEO services and processes. Onboard HR Solutions and PEO clients, following policies and procedures to ensure a smooth transition onto the HR Solutions or PEO service. Expediting the resolution of client problems or complaints to facilitate a positive onboarding experience. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required 2 years of experience in Relevant sales management experience.

Overview Consult with America's businesses, leveraging Paychex key referral channels and partnerships to educate stakeholders on our services, and provide consultative solutions to increase market share and drive revenue. Responsibilities Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Create, manage, and advance accounts, leads, and opportunities in company’s CRM system (Salesforce) and provide accurate sales activity and forecasts. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers in accordance with the client’s preference on in person or virtual interaction to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Complete onboarding training curriculum as directed. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity.

Analyzing the customer needs and interests, determining which products are appropriate and referring to appropriate party when necessary. Expediting the resolution of customer problems or complaints. Completing and submitting accurate new business paperwork, expense reports and weekly activity reports by agreed upon dates set by Sales management. Projecting a positive image in representing the Corporation to clients and the community. Achieving technical, competitive and sales skills knowledge. Competency is measured by the successful attainment of objectives and performance within the HR Solutions and PEO Sales. May be required to travel outside of geographical territory for purposes of attending Conference, training sessions and/or area Zone meetings. Attend partner meetings to educate on HR Solutions and PEO services and processes. Onboard HR Solutions and PEO clients, following policies and procedures to ensure a smooth transition onto the HR Solutions or PEO service. Expediting the resolution of client problems or complaints to facilitate a positive onboarding experience. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required 2 years of experience in Relevant sales management experience.

Responsibilities Discover your potential as an Account Executive in our Human Resource Services, Retirement Services, Customer Success, or Health and Benefits sales divisions selling primarily inside the Paychex client base. In this role, you will be responsible for expanding the breadth of our services to our Paychex client base thru prospecting and driving revenue to a monthly quota. Overview Under direct supervision from the Accounts Payable Supervisor, the Accounts Payable Specialist is responsible for the timely processing and audits of invoices, check requests and expense reports. Responsibilities Audits, codes and enters such items as invoices, expense reports, check requests and uploads into applicable financial system to ensure accurate sub-ledger data feeds to the general ledger. Protects the organizations value by verifying the accuracy and completeness of records and transactions based on Company and departmental policies. Acts as the main point of contact and receives, researches, and resolves a variety of routine internal and external inquiries concerning account status, including communicating the resolution of discrepancies to appropriate persons. Reviews and recommends updates to department procedures to ensure procedures are up to date and accurate. Recommends changes if necessary. Engages in monthly team and department meetings to ensure continued technical and self-development. Prepares and presents specific topics if requested Verifies the completeness and consistency of accounting or financial transactions to ensure that controls and policies are being met. Trains new employees and cross-trains existing employees on daily operational functions to ensure that technical skills are transferred consistently. Qualifications Associate's Degree in Accounting/Business/Finance - Preferred 1 year of experience in Work experience.

Overview Reporting to the Paychex Insurance Actuary, the incumbent will provide health and benefits analytical and actuarial services across the enterprise, particularly in support of our PEO segment. This will include but is not limited to data analytics, actuarial projections, and experience reporting to various leadership levels throughout the organization. Responsibilities Assist with performance assessments of Paychex health insurance programs, IBNR and corporate reserve calculations, and the pricing and financial forecasting of at-risk insurance programs. This may also include assisting in rate renewal negotiations with carriers for guaranteed cost insurance programs. Collaborate with our PEO Benefits, Underwriting, Pricing Desk, and PEO FP&A leadership to evaluate underwriting tools, underwriting performance, carrier performance, client segment performance, loss rates by plan designs, geography, sales district, etc. Contribute to the development of a substantial data analytics/health predictive modeling capability for identifying key performance drivers and action plans to continuously improve performance and competitiveness. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in STEM, Economics, Finance, or closely related field - Required 3 years of experience in Actuarial Services, Finance, Mathematics/Statistics, or Data Science 3 years of experience Health and Benefits Actuarial role (Pricing, Reserving, and/or Financial Forecasting) in a consulting or carrier environment Actively pursuing Society of Actuary exams towards Associateship/Fellowship (2+ exams preferred) Proficiency in Excel (including VBA), PowerBI, SQL, R (Preferred)

Uses business software applications (e.g., word processing, presentation and spreadsheet) to prepare correspondence, reports, presentations, agendas, minutes, etc. Receives, screens and directs incoming calls, visitors, mail and email. Maintains files, records, calendars and diaries. May arrange business travel, coordinate meeting arrangements, and/or track expenses. Schedules meetings, maintains calendars, and coordinates events; creates and distributes agenda and meeting summary. May provide support to other administrative and clerical assistants. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Associate's Degree - Preferred 3 years of experience in an administrative role.

Overview Assists the H&B sales force by being an essential sales partner to the territory agent during the initial sales effort. The Sales Development Associate will perform many of the pre-sales functions as well as many aspects and duties during the sales process that are inherent in the sale and installation of group insurance plans. Responsibilities Assists the territory sales agent and the branch in attainment of the insurance sales revenue goals. Aids the territory agent by conducting client enrollment meetings. Facilitates Educational CPE and Sales Seminars for prospective clients and CPA’s. Aids territory agents by answering client inquiries and questions of all nature associated with the sale. Conducts calls to prospective clients to gather information utilized by sales agents during the sales process. Assembles Pre-Appointment Workup and gathering data to aid territory agents. Completing Client Profile, which includes-Pulling Census, Payroll Journals, Coverage and Additional Products. Assembles Sales Literature for distribution to prospective clients. Assembles Sales Literature for distribution to prospective clients. Assembles Enrollment Kits for the conduct of client enrollment meetings. Aids territory agents by facilitating, overseeing and preparing quotes to prospective clients. Follows’ up on Missing Information/Items such as: Missing paperwork Missing employee information Assist with Cobra set up Scrub applications Develops and executes e-marketing campaigns at the branch level to support district sales goals. Works alongside the sales agent on-site gathering information during the sales process to assist the sales agent. Performs Web Portal software demonstrations at client locations to aide in the sales process. Presents sales quotes to prospective clients when applicable to obtain commitment on plan selections. Joins the territory agent on closing sales presentations as needed. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 1 year of experience in Carrier or insurance industry. Sales or account management experience. Life Accident and Health license

Overview The Mergers & Acquisitions Analyst has a significant role supporting Mergers & Acquisitions activities, including the strategic and financial evaluation of potential and active targets, financial modeling and valuation, business case development, M&A pipeline support and maintenance, and project support for deal activity. Responsibilities Supports the Corporate Development team across all phases of deal activity –deal sourcing, pipeline development, due diligence and post-close integration Supports the strategic evaluation and detailed financial analysis, modeling and valuation and development of buy and sell side M&A business cases, including DCF and multiples approaches Owns pipeline reporting and maintenance of pipeline database Supports the development of evaluation and diligence work plans Participates in the creation and development of deal documents and management presentations Develops and prepares presentations on the results of research and analysis of acquisition targets for use by Senior Management Supports deal pipeline development by researching potential acquisition targets. Research activities to include target industries and sectors, geographies, and specific companies using primary and secondary source research methods Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Accounting, Mathematics - Required 1 year of experience in M&A or investments evaluation or financial modeling and valuation with either an investment bank, M&A advisory / valuation services provider, private equity, asset manager or corporate development group. 1 year of experience in Financial and business analysis / modeling / valuation / forecasting, especially as used in M&A. Able to build valuation models. 1 year of experience in Company and industry research and analysis. Demonstrates analytical skills. Demonstrates problem solving skills. Excellent interpretation of complex statistical data. Ability to drive multiple projects to successful completion. Location Specific Compensation $70,000 - $100,000. Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview At Paychex, we believe every business, no matter how big or small, should have partners that take their security seriously. The mission of the Paychex Enterprise Security department is to safeguard the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information assets entrusted to Paychex and to continuously improve the security posture of the company and our customers. Cybersecurity engineers must continuously evolve their skillsets and tactics to stay one step ahead of sophisticated bad actors. Continuous evolution cannot be a passive endeavor; it must be pursued vigorously. As such, you will be challenged to expand your cybersecurity vision and subject matter knowledge to ensure Application Security delivers on its commitment to reducing company and customer risk. In this role, you will work with best in class security technologies deployed on-prem, in the cloud, and in hybrid configurations. You may also have the opportunity to pilot and operationalize new security technologies to enhance the application security function. Your expertise will be vital to maturing the policies and procedures that govern security operations. The work you deliver goes directly to securing Paychex and its clients and has visibility to and direct support from the highest levels of senior management. Responsibilities You will leverage and develop strong partnerships with peers across the delivery and security organizations to deliver value by: Managing identification, prioritization, and remediation guidance of security vulnerabilities and threats. Managing the security exception and review process as the need arises. Collaborating on the assessment of potential threats and risks to systems and technologies, driving remediation with internal and external partners. Tracking security events and incidents from initial detection through final resolution. Conducting research on tools, tech, and threats and presenting findings to Enterprise Security leadership, making recommendations to reduce risk. Producing and delivering secure coding training content to information technologists across the enterprise. Collaborate on cross functional projects inside and outside of Enterprise Security to ensure that security concerns are addressed throughout the project life cycle. Ensure security projects are delivered on time and on budget. Qualifications Expert level knowledge of OWASP Top-10 and API Top-10 vulnerabilities, CWE/SANS Top-25 weaknesses and how to identify and remediate in code. Expert ability to analyze information security risks, threats, and controls. Expert understanding of communicating and enforcing secure coding standards, best practices, and DevSecOps practices. Hands-on experience with static application security testing (SAST) tools such as Checkmarx, Fortify, Veracode or similar. Hands-on experience with one or more of the following programming languages and frameworks: Java, Spring, JavaScript, React, .NET, C#, ASP, Ruby. Hands-on or detailed analytical experience with one or more of the following technologies: Python, Flask, Django, PHP, Zend, Angular, Go, PowerShell, MySQL, Mongo, MSSQL, Metabase. Experience working within or alongside a CI/CD pipeline (Jenkins) including code quality gating. Beginner to intermediate understanding of supply chain security. Beginner to intermediate understanding of container infrastructure, deployment, and security (RedHat OpenShift preferred). 3 years of experience in Information Security or Cyber Security within an enterprise environment. Bachelor's Degree in Information Security, Software Development, or another related technical discipline. - Preferred Entry level cybersecurity certifications (Security +, (ISC)2 Associate, GSEC, CEH, etc.) – Preferred Experience working in an AGILE environment, using SCRUM and KANBAN - Preferred Location Specific Compensation $85,000 - $125,000 + Restricted Stock Units. Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview As an Application Test Lead I, you are the application expert. You have a deep understanding of the application you work on and you ensure this knowledge is shared and incorporated into the Agile process. You have hands-on experience exercising test scenarios and serve as the test and quality SME. Responsibilities Attend team agile ceremonies; lead discussions around test case scenarios ensuring proper coverage Support in-depth exploratory testing to provide coverage of non-automated scenarios as needed Lead test plan reviews with assistance from ATL II as needed Applies strong understanding of business workflows to test case scenario creation Able to influence others through strong relationships, application knowledge, respect, and trust Articulates and effectively communicates software testing issues, expected long and short term impacts and possible resolution alternatives in order to ensure test planning schedules are met Serves as test and quality SME; ensures testing gaps are mitigated Facilitates and supports UAT and E2E testing activities May assist in major incident triage and troubleshooting Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business or Computer Science or Engineering - Preferred 3 years of experience in Relevant, Paychex-specific product knowledge or equivalent industry experience required. Prior experience in Information Technology preferred.

Leads district sales effort to increase client base and drive revenue through the execution of approved sales and marketing programs.   Responsible for leading team to meet activity metrics as well as unit and revenue quota as directed by the Zone Manager. Coaches, supervises, and provides on-going training of assigned sales representatives in technical knowledge, competitive knowledge, and sales skills knowledge. Manages the achievement of corporate objectives by individual product line within area of district responsibility and within budgeted financial guidelines. Recruits, selects and directs sales staff to meet and/or exceed corporate goals. Monitors attainment versus forecast and takes corrective action when necessary. Identifies potential leadership candidates and brings to the attention of the Zone Manager. Cultivates and develops through the sales staff a referral network among the certified public accounting community, enrolled agents and bookkeepers. Works with partners in Service, HR/OD and other divisions of Sales to develop mutual objectives and problem-solve issues using partnership principles. Ensures accuracy of weekly activity reports and audits commission and expense reports. Initiates, participates in, and supervises on-going training of assigned sales representatives in technical knowledge, competitive knowledge, and sales skills knowledge. Manages items of corporate assigned budgets. May be required to travel for purposes of attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally.   Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or Marketing - Preferred 3 years of experience in Sales or marketing.

Responsibilities Manages the achievement of corporate objectives by individual product line within area of district responsibility and within budgeted financial guidelines. Recruits, selects and directs sales staff in meeting or exceeding corporate goals. Monitors attainment versus forecast and takes corrective action when necessary. Identifies potential management candidates and brings to the attention of the Zone Manager. Manages line by line items of corporate assigned budgets. Projects a positive image in representing the corporation to clients and the community. Cultivates and develops through the sales staff a referral network among the certified public accountants community, enrolled agents and bookkeepers. Works with branch managers to develop mutual objectives and problem-solving issues using partnership principles. Ensures accuracy of weekly activity reports and audits commission and expense reports. Initiates, participates in, and supervises on-going training of assigned sales representatives in technical knowledge, competitive knowledge, and sales skills knowledge. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or Marketing 3 years of experience in Sales or marketing.

Overview Leads district sales effort to increase client base and drive revenue through the execution of approved sales and marketing programs. jobTitle: Automation Release and Test Engineer III
jobDescription: Overview In this role as an Automation Release and Test Engineer III: you will design, develop, maintain, and execute automated configuration, release, and test processes across production/non-production environments. You will pursue, implement, and use carefully selected tools designed to create automated test suites that are usable by functional experts and that are robust, performant and reusable as well as increasingly efficient. For our Oracle commercial application ecosystem, you will implement and streamline automated methods for version control and migration of configuration changes to production and across nonproduction environments. Through these activities, you will enable your Agile team to deliver high-quality releases more frequently and efficiently. As an Agile team member, you will collaborate closely with development, product and other cross -functional groups to deliver high-quality products. Responsibilities Actively participate on an Agile team to drive throughput and deliver best-in-class automated release and testing solutions Create, automate, execute, maintain, and improve automated release trains for information technology solutions centered around Oracle EBS, Oracle CX Cloud, and Oracle Integration Cloud Design, implement, maintain and support well engineered processes that fuel commercial application experts with automated release, version control, and testing processes that are approachable by techno-functional commercial application experts. Design, implement and support commercial, open source, and custom automation tools. Investigate Paychex standards for CI/CD and release, and pursue, evaluate, and recommend efficient and scalable tools and methods that are built for throughput and optimized for the Oracle applications and surrounding technologies. Write and execute automated test suites for cases that cannot be handled via low code/no-code test authoring and execution: Web, API, UI, database, functional, Regression, smoke, black box, performance/load and end-to-end testing Use available tools supported by well-engineered, automated methods to automate version control and deployment of configuration changes to production and across non-production environments in a well-controlled but efficient manner Act as test Automation SME as needed to solve technical roadblocks and coordinate integration of automated tests. Mentor other team members in the areas of Release Automation, Test Automation and use of designed tools and processes Implement visualizations that raise confidence in release status, configuration synchronization, test execution, etc. Design and implement targeted, scalable test data generation services Support the creation of automation business cases and look for opportunities to advance the automation roadmap Review user documentation and training materials related to the application changes and/or infrastructure changes for accuracy and completeness, and to support changes and upgrades. Work with infrastructure, network engineering, and corporate applications support as needed to support the implementation and maintenance of tools, secure connection points, etc. and to provide test-ready environments. Provide estimates as input to product recommendation and as input to roadmaps. Acquire and utilize in-depth business, software application and technical knowledge to maximize effectiveness and quality when completing or assisting in the completion of automated release and testing tasks. Research and resolve issues related to automated release and testing tasks in appropriate time frame to assure test and planning schedules are met Ensure compliance with security and data obfuscation requirements Provide after-hours release and incident response support as required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer related discipline or equivalent work experience 5 years of experience in Related field. Expert level ability to evaluate, recommend, implement tools, and use and processes that enable automation of release and testing for the Oracle Commercial App environment. Experience with API contracts and associated testing patterns and available tools. Experience with writing automated test scripts to verify data structures, data formats and data values Demonstrated ability to create and execute SQL queries using modern RDBMS or NoSQL technologies Familiar with full Quality Assurance life cycle, test case management, testing methodologies, and installation and use of test automation tools such as Jira test case management, JUnit, JMeter, Selenium, etc. Some experience with UI based record and playback toolsets. Experience building and using test data generation services. Experience with automated configuration migration using Config Snapshot or similar tools. Experience with version control, code control, dependency control, code migration, rollback methodologies and tools such as GIT, Jenkins, Artifactory, etc. Location Specific Compensation Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents: $80,000 - $120,000 + RSU Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview As an Automation Test Engineer II, you will design, develop, execute and maintain automated test scripts. You will utilize test tools to create automated test suites that are robust, performant and reusable, enabling your Agile team to deliver high-quality releases more efficiently. As an Agile team member, you will collaborate closely with development, product and other cross-functional groups to deliver high-quality products. Responsibilities Participate on an Agile team to deliver best-in-class technical testing solutions With guidance, design, create, optimize, and refactor automated test scripts for client-server, web and mobile applications Ability to write, execute and debug basic automated test suites related to: Web, API, UI, database, functional, Regression, smoke, black box, performance/load and end-to-end testing Consult and collaborate with Test Automation SMEs as needed to solve technical roadblocks and coordinate integration of automated tests. Partner with Application Test Leader and agile team members to ensure proper test case coverage in all automated scenarios. Reviews and provides input on proposed new business requirements and their specifications and design documents to gain a thorough understanding of the application and/or infrastructure changes that are to be System and Regression tested. Reviews user documentation and training materials related to the application changes and/or infrastructure changes for accuracy and completeness. Provides testing estimates required for user stories based on business requirements, specifications and designs. Acquires and utilizes in-depth business, software application and technical knowledge to maximize effectiveness and quality when completing or assisting in the completion of testing tasks. Researches and resolves issues related to testing tasks in appropriate time frame in order to assure test planning schedules are met. Experience with Selenium, Robot Framework NODE, Java, Javascript .NET Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent work experience 5 years of experience as Testing and Automation Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents: $64,153.60 - $119,142.40 Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview All candidates for this role must be local to Rochester, St. Petersburg or Phoenix and able to attend training on-site. After training, bilingual roles are available remotely or on-site. If you are interested in an on-site non-bilingual role, please apply to this posting instead: hhttps://careers-paychex.icims.com/jobs/16269/retirement-service-center-associate/job?mode=view Under a significant level of guidance and direction, provides Spanish and English customer service for Paychex products with one of our Retirement Client Service Centers. Uses prescribed guidelines to ensure good customer relations are maintained and customer claims and complaints are resolved fairly, effectively, and in accordance with Paychex policies and procedures. Responsibilities Handles inbound calls from active and terminated participants/employees of Paychex client plans Handles inbound calls from client/employer 401(k) plan administrators Provides education on Paychex products, plan policies & procedures, or IRS guidelines & regulations Escalates tasks or documentation to other teams within the correct service department Develops and maintains a basic working knowledge of Paychex products Uses systems and software packages, which may include HRIS, Salesforce, Flex, Core Advanced, and ORS Documents all interactions, performs data entry, maintains strong prioritization and organization Translates for participants, clients and staff as needed Qualifications Fluency in English and Spanish - speak, read and translate Client or customer service experience - 1 year Research and problem solving skills Strong computer skills and the ability to multitask across multiple screens Contact center or call center experience - preferred Employee benefits, insurance, financial services, or tax-related experience - preferred Ability to work on-site, OR train on-site for a remote role

Overview Provides management of ongoing business programs critical for Paychex success. Leads the planning and ensures the execution of program initiatives and is responsible for accurate and consistent program reporting metrics. Responsibilities Lead programs with Paychex partners to improve business results with a focus on increased productivity and/or decreased expenses. Implement best practices, standards, and metrics across the organization to improve the consistency of results. Coordinate and lead post event analysis with affected teams to capture details of success, opportunity and exposure to drive improvement and client satisfaction in the program’s area(s) of focus. Continued focus on the program to drive improved procedures and focus on building the culture around the program. Implement and maintain a metrics system that reflects the area(s) measured. Maintain and grow revenue and/or reduce expenses in the focused area. Ensure continued coordination and communication of program. Identify underutilized program opportunities in both products and service and implement innovative strategies to drive increased activities in these areas. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business - Preferred Project management experience or certifications a plus. Excellent group facilitation skills – real experience with groups implementing multiple initiatives preferred. . 8 years of experience in Related field off shoring/outsourcing vendor management exp a plus

Consult with America's businesses, leveraging Paychex key referral channels and partnerships to educate stakeholders on our services, and provide consultative solutions to increase market share and drive revenue.   Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Create, manage, and advance accounts, leads, and opportunities in company’s CRM system (Salesforce) and provide accurate sales activity and forecasts. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers in accordance with the client’s preference on in person or virtual interaction to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Complete onboarding training curriculum as directed.   H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity.

Responsibilities Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity. **This is a remote postion, but does require you to live on the West Coast. Must live in CA, NV, ID to qualify**

Overview Independently performs complex accounting or finance functions and maintains an extensive understanding of these functions. Responsibilities Responsible for extensive knowledge of various systems, that could include ENS, HRIS, PARIS, Advantage, SurePayroll, ePlan, ORACLE, and the Frontier Reconciliation, in order to accurately resolve client activity to the various Paychex products. Reconciles client activity daily and reports reconciliation items to either the ASO Service Centers or the various Product Operation teams, to ensure timely resolution of reconciliation items, adhering to Sarbanes Oxley regulations and standards. Works closely with ASO Service Centers, Operational Departments, and Risk Management to facilitate the best client service possible, by providing detailed information to assist in timely resolution of issues, and ensuring that client payroll and product activity is accurate Completes both daily and month end reconciliations and creates journal entries to post to the G/L. Reports and audits monthly statistical data, reflecting ASO client and employee counts, ensuring accurate reporting to upper management. Responsible for adhering to multiple daily deadlines, to meet partner department requirements. Responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of appropriate internal and operational controls, as well as recommending improvements to controls, to ensure compliance with Sarbanes Oxley regulations and standards. Performs or reviews audit compliance to ensure adherence to procedures and controls according to internal and external policies. Responsible for complete, accurate and timely reconciliations, to ensure accurate financial reporting to internal and external sources. Performs advanced accounting or financial analysis, reporting and reconciliations, as assigned, in order to validate the integrity of the data and reporting that we provide to our customers, both internal and external. Works with IT and/or outside departments to assure timely reporting of system issues and assists in the resolution of the related reconciliation impact(s). Responsible for participating in special projects or other duties, to contribute to team success. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Or Associates Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business with 4 years of experience in Related field.

Overview Responsible for consulting with clients on human resource matters, best practices, employee handbook options and responding to and identifying compliance concerns that pertain to state and federal employment law questions. Responsibilities Advises clients regarding human resources matters, best practices, and employee handbook options. Identifies and clearly responds to client human resources and employment law inquiries/concerns utilizing appropriate resources. Builds strong client relationships and provides high quality service in an effort to maintain high client satisfaction and retention. Maintains knowledge of trends and changes in employment law legislation and conveys state and federal labor laws to internal partners and clients to maintain compliance. Offers innovative solutions or overcomes objections when resolving problems. Proactively and reactively follows up with clients as necessary regarding any HR or employment law topic. Supports client handbook creation and changes by partnering with client to gather relevant information. Fields inbound and makes outbound calls in order to support clients with available products and services. Evaluates and responds to inquiries regarding client billing and account information. Participates in special projects as assigned. Qualifications Associate's Degree - Preferred 1 year of experience in Client Service, Human Resources, HR Education, or combination of all. Location Specific Compensation Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs. From

Overview Ensures overall client satisfaction with products and services. Works with a small client demographic or less complex client base to assist with HR needs. Maintains ongoing relationship with client contacts and acts as the primary point of contact for HR service. Works collaboratively with internal partners to ensure quality customer service and support. Responsibilities Services clients both remotely and in-person and provides consultative guidance to ensure appropriate resolution of client issues. Partners and collaborates with internal departments/subject matter experts in delivering actionable responses or plans to clients concerns. Provides consultative guidance and advice to clients in the areas of Performance Management, Recruiting and Retention Strategies, Compensation, Performance Development, Employee Engagement and Culture Enhancement. May support PEO clients with set-up of EPLI insurance for with assistance of other internal business partners. May conduct open enrollment meetings for PEO clients, advising on benefit plan selection and contribution strategies. Communicates and interprets HR policies and procedures while providing remedies for any employee relations issue that may arise. Seeks appropriate guidance and support from HR Coach as applicable. Provides turnover analysis, action planning and offers unemployment escalation assistance. Maintains an awareness of HR trends and conducts training based on available resources. Promotes high-quality customer service to clients. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 1-3 years of experience in HR, or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Consideration may be given to a candidate with experience in lieu of a degree.

Overview Supports client reporting and client migration reporting needs. Creates Flex Report Writer reports based on Preview client migration needs and assists Field, Operations, Sales and external clients with Report Builder tool. Responsibilities Develops and provides customized client reports using reporting tools to meet reporting needs of our clients and internal partners. Collaborate with internal partners to gather report requirements and ensure report requirements are met through client validation. Resolve client Custom Analytic questions or issues to ensure timely client reporting. Analyze current Preview reports to ensure that they can be created in flex Pre-migration. Ensure APR’s are opened in instances where reports cannot be migrated. Represent PD&IT as subject matter experts on Custom Analytics. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required 5 years of experience in MMS or Core technical experience, client service, and business technical environment required. . Analytical skills, and ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users are required. Familiarity with the logical breakdown of a process, especially editing formulas and experience with Excel. Location Specific Compensation Compensation range for this role $25.00/hr - $38.00/hr + 3% bonus eligible Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview Function as a customer service representative who contacts clients to resolve issues, maintain our revenue stream and reinforce the features and benefits of our products. Works to entrench our position in the marketplace as a quality human resource services provider and differentiate us from our competitors. Responsibilities Communicate with high value clients to ensure satisfaction and contribute to successful achievement of regional retention goals. Respond to first level requests from the field to contact clients who are identified as being at risk. Address client concerns appropriately and follow up with the appropriate business unit as necessary Perform an in depth needs analysis during client interactions. Maintains current knowledge of Paychex products and services. Evaluate a client's suite of products and make any recommendation to ensure their business needs are met. Participates in various retention campaigns targeting specific client segments. Provide feedback to the business unit to assist in determining any patterns and help uncover root cause. Other duties as assigned to support the general purpose of the position's function. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Associate's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in customer service center/ telemarketing. 2 years of experience in General business experience, benefits and/or payroll a plus.

Overview Please note - this is an in office role located in our Albuquerque, NM office. This is not a remote / work from home role. $18 an hour Under a significant level of guidance and direction, provides customer service for one Paychex product. Uses prescribed guidelines to ensure good customer relations are maintained and customer claims and complaints are resolved fairly, effectively, and in accordance with Paychex policies and procedures. Responsibilities Delivers quality service to Paychex clients via phone, email, chat, and other avenues Develops and maintains a basic working knowledge of a single Paychex product Uses systems and software packages, which may include HRIS, Salesforce, Flex, Core Advanced, and ORS Performs data input, maintaining strong prioritization and organization Documents all interactions Qualifications Associate's Degree - Preferred Location Specific Compensation $18 an hour

Overview Discover Your Passion and Develop Your Expertise. This is a solution-based service environment with an emphasis on partnership and accountability. Service Professionals at Paychex are passionate about customers’ needs and wants. We offer more than jobs, we offer careers. We provide the training, development, benefits, and culture that you deserve so you can focus on reaching your fullest potential. Responsibilities In this role, you will… Support inbound call queue handling client calls to process payroll, enter payroll and tax information and answer questions for clients in multiple states. Learn and maintain knowledge of the payroll processing system, wage and tax laws to develop a trusted relationship with our clients. Provide online support, troubleshooting and handle escalations. Take initiative to elevate the client experience, quickly resolve situations and focus on one call resolution. Just some of the reasons why our employees are #Paychexproud. We value your well-being: From health care plans to retirement planning and wellness programs. We value your time: From paid time off, to company holidays as well as comprehensive work-life balance programs. We value your development: Our best-in-class training and development team will provide you with ongoing learning opportunities to give you the building blocks to grow your career at Paychex. We value your perspective: Our company culture reflects the diversity of our employees. We want you to be you. We value our community: We offer paid-time off for volunteerism and promote many company-wide and local initiatives that benefit organizations you care about. Qualifications This role is a strong fit if you have… 2-5 years customer service in a fast-paced environment. Ability to multi-task and handle high volume work load. onsite position located in Auburn Maine

Overview Responsibilities Responds to client phone calls in a timely manner and resolves client questions and issues, including payroll and tax-related matters, "How-To" product inquires, system issues, and first-level support of client input and/or output transmission issues in order to provide professional and personalized customer service. Ensures that client obtains full value from Major Markets products by providing client training over the phone and by periodically explaining additional reports and product features and their benefits. Ensures ongoing client satisfaction and high client retention by participating in designated client calling and other retention-oriented programs. Maintains knowledge of changes in Major Market system and software, trends in the PC industry, and changes in wage and tax law to provide informed guidance to the client. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with clients, agencies, and coworkers to promote Paychex' quality service image. Participates in conducting in-house client training sessions in order to enhance client relationships and to broaden employee knowledge and skill set. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required 3 years of experience in Technically-oriented customer service organization. Consideration may be given to a candidate with a degree in lieu of experience. Ability to build strong customer relationships.

Overview Supervises and directs a minimum of 5 Payroll Specialists in the provision of Paychex payroll services to clients. Provides leadership and technical advice on multiple product lines in order to resolve problems. Establishes and maintains positive image with clients and Payroll Specialists. May act in the role of the Branch Recruiter. Responsibilities Assists the Branch Manager with development of branch goals and improvement strategies to achieve branch operational objectives. Supervises and schedules staff; assigns, directs, and checks the work of assigned personnel to ensure quality client service. Provides technical expertise on multiple product lines to resolve client concerns and Paychex policy or procedural issues. Collaborates with Regional and Corporate personnel to identify and resolve system problems. Establishes and maintains a positive, professional relationship with clients and CPAs. Contacts local bank personnel and tax agencies as needed. Fosters a cohesive relationship between Sales and Operations to maintain a unified approach to branch management. Makes hiring recommendations and evaluates performance; recommends merit increases, promotion or termination, and disciplinary action to maximize team/branch performance. May act independently of Branch Manager. Supervises training of personnel; recommends, implements, and monitors on-the-job training and education to further professional advancement of assigned personnel. Maintains knowledge of changes in payroll laws and Paychex policies and procedures to further personal professional development. Reviews and recommends system changes to maintain the integrity of the payroll system. Acts as the focal point for branch recruiting activities related to sourcing, interviewing, and hiring to ensure that the best possible talent is hired. Assists Branch Manager with development of operating budgets, particularly with personnel requirements, to ensure that staff levels are within corporate metrics. Makes client visits to resolve issues and review payroll service as needed to insure the branch maintains the highest levels of client retention. Assists Branch Manager to meet revenue and retention goals. Plans, coordinates, and organizes quarter- and year-end processes to provide accurate and timely tax documents to clients. Monitors data integrity and Specialist workload to ensure an accurate payroll product for the client. Acts in place of the Branch Manager in his/her absence to ensure continuity of branch operations and to further develop his/her management skills. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Associate's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in As a Paychex Payroll Specialist or Senior Payroll Specialist with successful completion of Advanced Certification Training. 2 years of experience in Payroll processing and tax regulations and a strong customer service background. Consideration may be given to a candidate with a degree in lieu of experience. . Ability to build strong customer relationships.

Overview Supervises and directs a minimum of 5 Payroll Specialists in the provision of Paychex payroll services to clients. Provides leadership and technical advice on multiple product lines in order to resolve problems. Establishes and maintains positive image with clients and Payroll Specialists. May act in the role of the Branch Recruiter. Responsibilities Assists the Branch Manager with development of branch goals and improvement strategies to achieve branch operational objectives. Supervises and schedules staff; assigns, directs, and checks the work of assigned personnel to ensure quality client service. Provides technical expertise on multiple product lines to resolve client concerns and Paychex policy or procedural issues. Collaborates with Regional and Corporate personnel to identify and resolve system problems. Establishes and maintains a positive, professional relationship with clients and CPAs. Contacts local bank personnel and tax agencies as needed. Fosters a cohesive relationship between Sales and Operations to maintain a unified approach to branch management. Makes hiring recommendations and evaluates performance; recommends merit increases, promotion or termination, and disciplinary action to maximize team/branch performance. May act independently of Branch Manager. Makes client visits to resolve issues and review payroll service as needed to insure the branch maintains the highest levels of client retention. Assists Branch Manager to meet revenue and retention goals. Plans, coordinates, and organizes quarter- and year-end processes to provide accurate and timely tax documents to clients. Monitors data integrity and Specialist workload to ensure an accurate payroll product for the client. Acts in place of the Branch Manager in his/her absence to ensure continuity of branch operations and to further develop his/her management skills. Qualifications H.S.
