Acts as a dedicated commercial lines account executive, licensed agent, and internal liaison for a specific 'book of business' that is based on a defined premium amount. Meets or exceeds set expectations around customer service delivery and client retention goals. Provides client with the most consultative and thorough service experience including on boarding, proactive consultative / relationship activities and renewals to ensure business insurance portfolio meets the client's cost and benefit objectives.   Initiates regularly scheduled proactive relationship calls with clients providing updates on relevant insurance specific topics and administrative services to assess and meet client’s current needs. Initiates consultative calls to client to assess underwriting exposures prior to policy renewal to ensure renewal is written correctly. Provides creative business insurance solutions to clients from current and alternate carriers during each client renewal, or as requested by client off cycle, to meet client’s premium and benefit requirements. Responsible for developing and executing a book of business and retention strategy. Responsible for meeting specific client retention goals for assigned book of business in support of Agency financial goals. Place existing policies with alternative carriers (if required) to assist client in achievement of their benefit and premium objectives. Works as a liaison between policy holder and Insurance Carrier/IA to ensure the highest level of customer service is provided. Works as a liaison between internal Paychex departments to ensure the highest level of customer service across product lines. Utilizes knowledge of carrier and state underwriting guidelines to guide client toward the best possible option within the Paychex Agency’s administrative capabilities. Up sells and/or resells, or refers ancillary products to meet set expectations as directed by management to meet Agency financial goals. Responsible for establishing and maintaining ongoing client relationships, overall client satisfaction, and client retention to support Agency financial goals. Responsible for meeting service level goals including response time and quality standards to ensure customer service expectations are met. Develops and maintains expert knowledge of related product offerings including Safety and Loss, Paychex PEO, and Health and Benefits to facilitate cross-product issue resolution. Develops and maintains expert knowledge of industry trends, product offerings, and legislative and compliance changes to ensure client consultative objectives are met.   Bachelor's Degree - Required 7 years of experience in Commercial Insurance industry, Sales or Customer Service experience. Property and Casualty license Broker Property Baggage Personal Lines Casualty License is preferred for candidates. Employees hired into this position without P&C license are required to obtain the P&C license within 90 days of employment. - Required

Overview Provide support and analysis in order to ensure accurate and timely distribution of sales commission and bonuses, corporate sponsored sales programs, reporting, and recognition and rewards for the sales organization. Responsibilities Prepares monthly sales and commission data to ensure accurate payment of commissions for all sales personnel and divisions in accordance with the associated compensation plans. Builds compensation plans within Oracle Incentive Compensation (OIC) application. Builds reports within Oracle Analytics (OBIEE) module to support reporting needs for the Sales organization. Ensures that all assigned internal analysis and monthly close processes for the Core and MMS Commission Cycle are completed on time and within quality control guidelines. Performs monitoring controls to ensure the accuracy of data within OIC, working with Corporate Commissions Coordinators to make necessary corrections in a timely manner throughout the monthly commission cycle. Establishes and documents standard operating procedures to support daily usage and maintenance of OIC and associated commission systems. Assists the Corporate Commission Managers in developing new system enhancement projects as well as design and analyze current system enhancements while assisting in the development of new procedures and processes in order to meet changing compensation plan requirements or improve the overall efficiency of the commissions process. Works with Corporate Support to appropriately identify system related issues and developing resolutions to rectify potential and existing problems. Responds in a timely and accurate manner to all levels of sales management, including senior management and their assistants, to address all issues concerning the Core/MMS sales division. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting or Finance 3 years of experience in Related field, consideration may be given to a candidate with a degree of lieu of experience.

Overview The incumbent is responsible for entering, analyzing and processing payroll, running reports, and other payroll-related tasks. Assists with the calculation and preparation of corporate payroll tax filings, ensuring the timely remittance of taxes due, with guidance from Corporate Payroll Tax Analyst and Corporate Payroll Tax Supervisor This is a high volume, deadline driven position that requires accuracy and a customer-service focus. Responsibilities Enters, researches, and analyzes employee payroll and tax related data including garnishment, absence management or new hire necessary to process and meet weekly and bi-weekly payroll processing. Assists with the calculation and preparation of corporate payroll tax filings to ensure the timely remittance of Federal, State and Local taxes, with guidance from the Analysts and Supervisor. Maintains knowledge of the payroll processing system, changes in garnishment, wage and tax laws at the federal, state and level, voluntary and involuntary deductions, and industry trends in the FMLA to serve as a subject matter expert and develop a trusted relationship with both internal and external partners. Researches and resolves complex employee and system problems to ensure accurate payroll including ability to calculate federal, state and local taxable wages. Corresponds with internal and external departments in conjunction with the employee to resolve to resolve concerns relating to federal, state, and local taxation. Participates on various project teams as a representative of Payroll to ensure appropriate oversight of department needs. Provides second-level response to all inquiries via email, mail, and phone, in accordance with department policy, to ensure quality service standards are met. Communicates issues and provides status updates to Leadership team. Generates, reviews, and distributes reports to Supervisor and peers to ensure accuracy of data and compliance with applicable Federal and State laws and Paychex policies, including Sarbanes Oxley. Engages in monthly team and department meetings to ensure continued technical and self-development. Prepares and presents specific topics, if requested. Trains new employees and cross-trains existing employees on procedures and procedure changes to ensure compliance with Federal, State and Local governances. Writes and reviews department procedures to ensure resources are up to date and accurate. Recommends changes if necessary. Qualifications Associate's Degree in Accounting/Business/Finance - Preferred 3 years of experience in Related field .

Overview Responsible for mitigating credit risk to Paychex by authenticating incoming clients, monitoring the credit quality of our portfolio, and assessing risk on individual client transactions. Provides quality service to internal and external customers through accurate and timely problem resolution. Responsible for product knowledge including Direct Deposit, Readychex, Taxpay, ASO, and PEO. Hours: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm EST Responsibilities Reviews and approves or denies credit transactions up to $50,000 in order to mitigate potential risk and ensure the best financial decision is implemented for Paychex as well as the client. Prepares recommendations to management on items exceeding $50,000. Reviews and interprets credit reports (Equifax, Experian and Dun & Bradstreet) and financial, trade, and public record data to assist in the credit decision making process. Works with external banking partners to authenticate banking information and ensure funds availability for credit transactions. Requests and secures wire transfers for high liability and high risk transactions. Authenticates and evaluates fraud and credit risk on incoming customers across all lines of business based on authentication tools and credit data. Assigns credit lines to customers. Manages portfolio of customers through credit monitoring, bankruptcy identifications, cash flow issues, and negative news monitoring. Meets inbound call requirements and makes outbound calls to assist with customer inquiries, problem resolution, and to obtain necessary information for risk assessments. Is able to demonstrate high level of customer service. Develops and maintains comprehensive knowledge of all applicable Paychex products, regulatory changes, policy changes, and industry and economic developments. Qualifications Associate's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related discipline - Required Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related discipline - Preferred 2 years of experience in Banking, finance, accounting, and/or customer service. Demonstrates customer service skills. Demonstrates problem solving skills. Demonstrates excellent judgment and decision making skills. Demonstrates time management and priority setting skills. Highly thorough and dependable. Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.

Overview Under consultative direction, initiates, plans, develops, and manages multiple ongoing and complex Data Science Projects critical for Paychex success. Leads the planning and ensures the execution of Data Science Projects (Ad-Hoc Analysis & Reports, Advanced Analysis, Predictive Models, Ongoing Support) using defined and repeatable processes. Responsible for accurate and consistent program reporting metrics & communicating Data Science Technical results to Management and Business Stakeholders. Responsibilities Provides ongoing Data Science program management critical for Paychex success. Leads the planning and ensures the execution of program initiatives and is responsible for accurate and consistent program reporting metrics. Participates on Data Science projects using data engineering and/or modeling skills. Leads projects with Paychex partners to improve business results with a focus on increased productivity and/or decreased expenses. Implement best practices, standards, and metrics across the Data Science organization to improve the consistency of results. Liaisons with enterprise partners implementing advanced analytics to minimize redundancy, coordinate resources & tools to maintain and grow revenue and/or reduce expenses in the Data Science department and across the enterprise. Liaison with Paychex IT partners to ensure innovation and a unified Data Science platform for development and production projects. Ensures continued coordination and communication of Data Science program. Identify underutilized program opportunities in both products and service and implement innovative strategies to drive increased activities in these areas. Coordinates and lead post event analyses with affected teams to capture success, opportunity and exposure details to drive improvement and internal client satisfaction in the program’s area(s) of focus. Articulates and helps demonstrate to key stakeholders that data science is critical asset to drive enterprise growth. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business, Information Technology, MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or closely related discipline - Required Master's Degree in MBA, IT, CS, Data Science, Engineering or Science related degree - Preferred 3 years of experience in Data Science, CRISP-DM, data management, business analysis, business intelligence, business processes, planning & reporting. 3 years of experience in Working across teams, coordination, planning, & tracking. Excellent group facilitation skills – real experience with groups implementing multiple initiatives. Multi-tasking; initiating, planning, and tracking of multiple simultaneous projects . 3 years of experience in Reporting & Presentations. Creation & presentation of Data Science results to Business Stakeholders. Ability to translate technical results to business impact . Effective negotiation skills. Ability to influence internal and/or external constituents.

Overview A position under moderate supervision, responsible for troubleshooting, installing, configuring, and maintaining databases and applications in support of business requirements. Performs database installation and upgrades, including patching. Provides technical support during critical and non-critical business hours. Proactively identifies and automates the resolution to availability and performance failures throughout the environment. Creates and maintains technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of Information Technology (IT) personnel. Responsibilities Provides technical support during critical and non-critical business hours on database systems. Is proactive and reactive for problem alerting, analysis, resolution, and follow-up to ensure database stability. Supports cross-functional project teams with sprint planning and execution as well as database support and maintenance activities. This includes database analysis and design, defect identification and remediation, database build and configuration tasks, incident response, and similar IT system support activities to help deliver solutions as required. Creates and maintains technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of IT personnel. Identifies and automates the resolution to database availability and performance failures throughout the environment. Deploys, configures, and supports mostly simple and occasionally moderately complex databases in physical, virtual, and cloud environments for use by internal and external applications. Performs database upgrades/patching as well as periodic health checks in accordance with established policies and procedures. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience Experience in Database Administration and DevOPs Automation. Location Specific Compensation Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents $80,000-$115,000 Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview Paychex North America Inc. seeks a full time Database Engineer II at our offices located at 675 Basket Road, Webster, NY 14580. Reference Job# ID 2022-16977. Responsibilities Perform troubleshooting, installing, configuring, maintaining and upgrading Oracle databases and applications using Oracle software, tools and utilities in support of business requirements. Duties include: Support cross-functional project teams with sprint planning and execution as well as database support and maintenance activities, including database analysis and design, defect identification and remediation, database build and configuration tasks, incident response, and similar IT system support activities to help deliver solutions; Provide technical support for database systems during critical and non-critical business hours, including problem alerting, analysis, resolution, and follow-up to ensure database stability; Deploy, configure, and support databases in physical, virtual, and cloud environments for use by internal and external applications; Perform database upgrades and patching, as well as periodic health checks, in accordance with established policies and procedures; Identify and automate the resolution to database availability and performance failures throughout the environment using PERL and shell scripting; Performance monitoring and tuning of the databases using Oracle Enterprise Manager/Grid Control, EXPLAIN PLAN, SQLTRACE, TKPROF, STATSPACK, AWR , ADDM; Perform backup and recovery of the databases using RMAN; Write, modify, enhance, test, debug programs using SQL, PL/SQL programming languages, shell scripting, Windows, Unix, and Linux; Participate in the creation of database standards, designs, best practices, and roadmaps for IT systems and technologies; Perform troubleshooting of different technologies including MongoDB, Exadata, and SQL Server; Create and maintain technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of Information Technology (IT) personnel. Qualifications Master’s degree (or foreign degree equivalent) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or closely related field, plus three years of experience in a database administration role. In the alternative, employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree (or foreign degree equivalent) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or closely related field, plus five years of experience in a database administration role. Experience, which may be gained concurrently, must include each of the following: 3 years of experience performing installation, configuration and administration of Oracle databases using various technologies including GoldenGate, GoldenGate for Heterogeneous databases, RAC, RMAN, and Exadata; 3 years of experience performing database automation using PERL and shell scripting; 2 years of experience writing, modifying, enhancing, testing, and debugging programs using MYSQL, MSSQL, and PostgreSQL; 2 years of experience performing troubleshooting utilizing MongoDB. Position requires participation in off-hours support rotation. Position is eligible for Employee Referral Program. Reference Job# ID 2022-16977.

Overview A lead position under limited supervision requiring in-depth knowledge and experience in a wide spectrum of information technology systems, services, applications and related technologies. The candidate provides advice, guidance, and leadership to less senior team members and staff. The candidate works independently and is responsible for troubleshooting, installing, configuring, and maintaining hardware, operating systems, applications and related infrastructure and services in support of business service and requirements. The candidate is engaged in designing and implementing innovative service delivery, management, and administration solutions that leverage the latest virtualization, automation, orchestration, and security technologies. The candidate provides technical support, advice and guidance during critical and non-critical business hours responding to automated alerts and escalated incidents and requests. The candidate applies knowledge and skills to proactively identify opportunities to improve service delivery, reliability and performance creating, and implementing innovative solutions and automated process. In addition, candidate provides advice, guidance and training to less senior systems engineers and support staff, creates and maintains technical reference documentation used in support and training of Information Technology personnel. The position requires the continuing development of skills to support, administer, and engineer innovative integrated, cross-platform solutions that support the operations and goals of Paychex. The position exposes the candidate to all endpoint operating systems (Windows, MacOS, Linux) systems management and security services (SCCM, Citrix, McAfee, Powerbroker, Active Directory) and scripting and programming tools (Powershell, .Net). In addition, the candidate is expected to leverage system, OS, and application virtualization technologies, automation and orchestration as a means to deliver and support end-user services at Paychex. The candidate leverages the latest technologies from Microsoft, Citrix, Hewlett Packard, Adobe, Oracle, EMC, VMWare, McAfee, Cisco, Riverbed, Google, ServiceNow and others in our IT environment that are critical to delivering information technology services. The candidate will participate on project and delivery teams with cross-functional engineers, software developers, architects, business representatives, and many more responsible for delivering new and upgraded products, services, features / functionality, and remediating defects and issues for Paychex's end-user computing environment and related services. Responsibilities Supports cross-functional project teams to help deliver solutions as required. Participates in and leads personnel involved in system outages during critical and non-critical business hours on complex hardware, operating system, and software. Is proactive and reactive for problem alerting, analysis, resolution, and follow-up to ensure hardware, application, and service stability and availability. Provides guidance and advice to less senior systems engineers. Coordinates and leads system and service maintenance activities. Performs highly complex application and service upgrades (hardware, operating system, software) as well as regular health checks in accordance with established corporate policies and procedures. Creates and maintains technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of Information Technology (IT) personnel. Proactively identifies, develops, and implements automated service delivery, provisioning and remediation processes that reduce or eliminate user interaction and enhance system and service reliability. Leads, guides, and trains team members on servers and their related systems. Proactively identifies, remediates, and automates the identification and resolution of system and service failures and performance issues. Proactively identifies opportunities for service delivery performance improvement and automation. Recommends and participates in the creation of corporate standards, best practices, and roadmaps for Information Technology end-point systems, services, and technologies. Recommends and participates in the creation of designs for corporate IT systems. Spends a small amount of time acting as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leads capacity and budget planning exercises including planned and unplanned projects, projections for future growth, and license management. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer related discipline and/or an IT certification in an applicable field - Preferred 6 years of experience in Applicant should have experience in IT systems administration and process management. 10+ years of experience in Applicant will have extensive experience with and a working knowledge of information technology security, management, administration, and service delivery process leveraging a wide spectrum of enterprise technologies and services. .

Overview A lead position under limited supervision requiring in-depth knowledge and experience in a wide spectrum of information technology systems, services, applications and related technologies. The candidate provides advice, guidance, and leadership to less senior team members and staff. The candidate works independently and is responsible for troubleshooting, installing, configuring, and maintaining hardware, operating systems, applications and related infrastructure and services in support of business service and requirements. The candidate is engaged in designing and implementing innovative service delivery, management, and administration solutions that leverage the latest virtualization, automation, orchestration, and security technologies. The candidate provides technical support, advice and guidance during critical and non-critical business hours responding to automated alerts and escalated incidents and requests. The candidate applies knowledge and skills to proactively identify opportunities to improve service delivery, reliability and performance creating, and implementing innovative solutions and automated process. In addition, candidate provides advice, guidance and training to less senior systems engineers and support staff, creates and maintains technical reference documentation used in support and training of Information Technology personnel. The position requires the continuing development of skills to support, administer, and engineer innovative integrated, cross-platform solutions that support the operations and goals of Paychex. The position exposes the candidate to all endpoint operating systems (Windows, MacOS, Linux) systems management and security services (SCCM, Citrix, McAfee, Powerbroker, Active Directory) and scripting and programming tools (Powershell, .Net). In addition, the candidate is expected to leverage system, OS, and application virtualization technologies, automation and orchestration as a means to deliver and support end-user services at Paychex. The candidate leverages the latest technologies from Microsoft, Citrix, Hewlett Packard, Adobe, Oracle, EMC, VMWare, McAfee, Cisco, Riverbed, Google, ServiceNow and others in our IT environment that are critical to delivering information technology services. The candidate will participate on project and delivery teams with cross-functional engineers, software developers, architects, business representatives, and many more responsible for delivering new and upgraded products, services, features / functionality, and remediating defects and issues for Paychex's end-user computing environment and related services. Responsibilities Supports cross-functional project teams to help deliver solutions as required. Participates in and leads personnel involved in system outages during critical and non-critical business hours on complex hardware, operating system, and software. Is proactive and reactive for problem alerting, analysis, resolution, and follow-up to ensure hardware, application, and service stability and availability. Provides guidance and advice to less senior systems engineers. Coordinates and leads system and service maintenance activities. Performs highly complex application and service upgrades (hardware, operating system, software) as well as regular health checks in accordance with established corporate policies and procedures. Creates and maintains technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of Information Technology (IT) personnel. Proactively identifies, develops, and implements automated service delivery, provisioning and remediation processes that reduce or eliminate user interaction and enhance system and service reliability. Leads, guides, and trains team members on servers and their related systems. Proactively identifies, remediates, and automates the identification and resolution of system and service failures and performance issues. Proactively identifies opportunities for service delivery performance improvement and automation. Recommends and participates in the creation of corporate standards, best practices, and roadmaps for Information Technology end-point systems, services, and technologies. Recommends and participates in the creation of designs for corporate IT systems. Spends a small amount of time acting as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leads capacity and budget planning exercises including planned and unplanned projects, projections for future growth, and license management. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer related discipline and/or an IT certification in an applicable field - Preferred 6 years of experience in Applicant should have experience in IT systems administration and process management. 10+ years of experience in Applicant will have extensive experience with and a working knowledge of information technology security, management, administration, and service delivery process leveraging a wide spectrum of enterprise technologies and services. .

jobTitle: Director, Enterprise and Multi-Product Service - Onboarding
jobDescription: Overview Responsible for the development and management of the strategy, products and onboarding service model for Enterprise Services. Provides direction, guidance and development to the onboarding team in order to accomplish established business targets including profitability, client retention and growth. Responsibilities Directs and leads the Enterprise Services Onboarding organization to ensure business targets are achieved. Sets strategy for seamless client onboarding across the entire Paychex product suite to ensure a positive influence on net promotor scores and create clients for life. Translates strategic priorities into operational reality by aligning communication, accountabilities, resource capabilities, internal processes, and ongoing measurement systems to ensure that strategic priorities yield measurable and sustainable results. Develops and manages the implementation model to ensure the solutions and execution meets both Paychex and client needs. Leads and coordinates operations planning, resourcing, staffing, progress reporting for implementations of new clients on the new product. Builds strong partnerships with external and internal stakeholders to understand business challenges, set strategy, manage change and resolve problems to support our enterprise clients. Creates and executes influence strategies that gain commitment to one’s ideas and persuades key stakeholders to take action that will advance shared interests and business goals. Recruits, selects, hires and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure all department needs are handled appropriately. Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs and other resources as required for professional development. Prepares the capital and operating budgets for the cost center(s) and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost center(s). Achieves cost center projections through labor expense and administrative expense controls. Participates in the development and directs the implementation of new policies and procedures related to Enterprise Services Onboarding. Responsible for driving a culture of innovation and continuous process improvement to ensure process/procedures remain relevant and allow for the most efficient execution. Ensures compliance at all levels of the Enterprise Services product and service component. Maintains current knowledge on trends and competitors in the mid-market space to ensure our service approach continues to meet client and market demands. Leads our digital and global transformation with the organization and across the Enterprise. Embraces Diversity, Equity and Inclusion within our core values. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required 7 years of experience in Management experience in corporate or field.

Identifies and establishes strategic direction for the Network, Telecommunications and Technical Engineering and Operations program through development and maintenance of internal and external customer-facing systems and programs. Assesses the relative impact of industry trends to current and future enterprise infrastructure and security needs and projects. Interfaces with business unit executives and other functional area executives to define support initiatives and solutions for improving service efficiency and effectiveness. Identifies and establishes strategic direction for the Network (MAN, WAN, Wireless, Data Center), Unified Communications, Endpoint hardware and software (desktop), Collaboration applications (such as Office 365 email, Mobility, SharePoint, WebEx, Chat and Team spaces), Production Print Services, Field Engineering (physical data center) programs, through development and maintenance of internal and external customer-facing systems and programs. Researches and recommends courses of action to mitigate risk and to maintain high infrastructure service levels for the user community. Assesses the relative impact of industry trends to current and future enterprise infrastructure and security needs and projects. Interfaces with business unit executives and other functional area executives to define support initiatives and solutions for improving service efficiency and effectiveness. Ensures that technology integrations meet business requirements, employee productivity and external customer service levels. Participates in IT strategy planning activities, bringing a current knowledge and future vision of network, unified communications, end-point, collaboration, field engineering and production print systems and best practices (e.g., ITIL) as related to the needs of the business. Defines and communicates department vision and mission. Establishes annual goals and plans strategy for completing goals. Establishes metrics, key performance indicators and service level agreements for driving the performance of IT. Manages vendor relationships, including negotiations of contracts, pricing, service levels, technology reviews and selections of network, end point, unified communications, production print, collaboration, physical data center maintenance support for all hardware and software leading to cost effectiveness, proper technology and support of Paychex’ business units / clients recognizing that network, unified communications, end points, collaboration, production print, field engineering are a very significant expense that can positively or negatively affect company profitability. Directs department managers which include staff development, performance appraisal, goal development, salary management, training, coaching and improvement of staff performance to increase the group’s effectiveness. Manages company multi-million-dollar communications budget and operating plan (Cellular, Long Distance, Network, Telecom, Local) as well as multi-million-dollar technology expense (Data Center Leases, IP/Voice Maintenance, Productivity systems Licensing, Printer Maintenance, Communications Systems and Mobile Platforms, Network). Must accurately forecast expense YoY, find ways to reduce expense, manage technology renewals to plan.   Bachelor's Degree in IT, Computer Science, Business, Engineering, or equivalent experience 10+ years of experience managing large teams. Experience managing multi-million dollar program budgets, work plans, resource plans and overall program governance. 10+ years of experience in Information Technology management and leadership positions. Extensive experience delivering and supporting robust, scalable projects.

Overview Leads and directs all financial functions of assigned business units. Provides financial and operational analytical support to functions across all businesses for sound decision making and strategy development. Responsibilities Partners with Senior VPs and leadership team of assigned business unit to provide tactical and strategic business financial consulting. Participates as an active business partner on the Leadership team to offer strategic insight and partner on strategic projects. Analyzes and interprets all division financial results regularly and recommends corrective actions to ensure performance targets are achieved. Partners with other Finance functions and business units to ensure financial reporting incorporates appropriate measures to drive business performance. Evaluates the financial implications of pricing actions, new product launches, strategic partnerships, and changes in delivery model to ensure decisions are made with an understanding of the financial impact. Leads Operating Plan process with the management team, including revenue development, quota development, expense budgeting, etc., to ensure appropriate performance goals are developed to meet company objectives. Updates sales/financial forecasts and coordinates with the FP&A group to ensure forecasted PAR is properly captured in the Financial Forecasts. Reviews monthly financial results and works with Corporate Accounting group to identify variances and ensure all transactions are properly captured. Partners with management on analysis of acquisition prospects or new product launches to evaluate revenue and margin opportunities. Supports business units in determining the ROI of strategic initiatives to ensure maximum resource utilization. Recruits, selects, hires, and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure all departmental needs are handled appropriately. Provides coaching and development support to supervisors and employees to aid in professional development. Prepares the capital and operating budgets and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost centers. Achieves cost center projections through labor expense and administrative expense controls. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Finance 10+ years of experience in Accounting and Financial Planning and Analysis. 8 years of experience in Management experience.

jobTitle: Director of Sales - Major Markets Enterprise
jobDescription: Overview Provides direction, as well as administrative and operational support, to District Sales Managers and sales staff in a zone to ensure increased corporate sales and profits through an increased client base. Responsibilities Manages the ultimate achievement of corporate objectives by individual product line category within specified geographical areas and within budgeted financial guidelines. Administers, directs and monitors activities of District Sales operations to ensure adherence to and implementation of corporate sales plans and programs. Reviews performance against forecast and takes corrective action where necessary. Initiates, participates in, and supervises on-going training of district sales managers in sales management training skills and effectiveness for future career development. Recruits, selects, hires district sales managers. Evaluates and recommends personnel actions, such as promotion, salary changes, termination. Establishes and maintains communication links at all levels to ensure positive working relationship and productivity. Establishes and maintains strategies to improve client base, administers sales and client incentive programs. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration Experience must be in second level sales management. 5 years of experience in Marketing or sales.

Overview Leads district sales effort to increase client base and drive revenue through the execution of approved sales and marketing programs. Responsibilities Responsible for leading team to meet activity metrics as well as unit and revenue quota as directed by the Zone Manager. Coaches, supervises, and provides on-going training of assigned sales representatives in technical knowledge, competitive knowledge, and sales skills knowledge. Manages the achievement of corporate objectives by individual product line within area of district responsibility and within budgeted financial guidelines. Recruits, selects and directs sales staff to meet and/or exceed corporate goals. Monitors attainment versus forecast and takes corrective action when necessary. Identifies potential leadership candidates and brings to the attention of the Zone Manager. Cultivates and develops through the sales staff a referral network among the certified public accounting community, enrolled agents and bookkeepers. Works with partners in Service, HR/OD and other divisions of Sales to develop mutual objectives and problem-solve issues using partnership principles. Ensures accuracy of weekly activity reports and audits commission and expense reports. Initiates, participates in, and supervises on-going training of assigned sales representatives in technical knowledge, competitive knowledge, and sales skills knowledge. Manages items of corporate assigned budgets. May be required to travel for purposes of attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or Marketing - Preferred 3+ years of sales leadership experience 3+ years os sucessfull Busienss to Business sales experience Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents: $80,000-$100,000 base salary with $120,000-$150,000k on track earnings + RSUs Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview Creates and governs the design of complex enterprise systems, with consideration of the interactions between and the impacts of changes to the Paychex organization, its business and operating models, underlying data, and the applications and infrastructure supporting them. Communicates recommendations and architectural direction to business and technical stakeholders, up to and including the executive level. Responsibilities Works with technical and business stakeholders to define enterprise architectures of mission critical, enterprise-wide systems, with consideration of the impact on the Paychex business and operating models and any applicable enterprise goals of the organization Works with internal business partners and analysts to rationalize and optimize business processes Designs, documents, implements, and promotes the use of appropriate system improvements and necessary changes to meet Paychex, portfolio, and project goals Clearly, consistently, and concisely captures and communicates the key components of an architecture to the assigned teams through engaging presentations and clear documentation Reviews and maintains the technology, tool, technique, and platform roadmaps and standards. These standards will be used as a baseline for design evaluations and adoption across all portfolios. Understand data interdependencies across the enterprise; help identify and avoid business and technical risks. Reviews project charters to ensure feasibility and escalate issues to the program or portfolio Provides oversight through project completion to ensure execution aligns with the architecture; a good balance of pragmatism with an ability to remain firm when required Ensures that assigned project goals are met within expected timelines and following Paychex standards Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Development, or related discipline Full lifecycle experience designing mission critical, large scale, highly available, scalable software-intensive systems. Experience in requirements gathering. Experience with loosely coupled architectures a plus. Experience with large scale third-party systems integration projects, including Salesforce and Oracle ERP, a plus. 5 years of experience in at least one of the following six architecture pillars (Data, Business, Integration, Application, Innovation, and/or Infrastructure).

Overview Provides direct supervision and development of Print and Fulfillment Center personnel. Ensures that quality products are delivered to our clients and customers in an accurate and timely manner by managing day-to-day workflow/processing of the center. Responsibilities Supervises employees in all aspects of Enterprise Print and Fulfillment Center (Print Operations, Insertion and Distribution/Fulfillment); monitors work flow using key indicators and staff to ensure deadlines and accuracy requirements are met. This includes monitoring printing, packing and delivery of payrolls. Strategically plans current and future production and printing capacities and utilizes technology and work flow enhancements to improve processes and to ensure staffing and materials are ready. Supports less predictable product lines with the need to be able to multi-task and adapt to situations and requests to ensure business unit and client needs are met. May need to coordinate efforts outside of the EPFC as needed. Provides technical expertise to solve problems regarding internal, field office and client issues. Ensures that quality service is provided to both the field offices and clients and uses judgment skills to make decisions for client concerns. Maintains knowledge of technology and vendor tools available to the EPFC to ensure best practices are followed and proper equipment and solutions are utilized by the department. Recruits, selects, hires, and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure that all departmental needs are handled appropriately. Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs, and other resources. Represents the department on teams and projects to ensure that the actions of the team are met and are in line with departmental goals. Assists business units by consulting on what can be offered to build their products. Oversees and facilitates installation of equipment in the computer room and insertion areas to ensure the setup is performed properly, accurately and timely. Builds and strengthens relationships with business units and vendors to improve processes and enhance the service levels provided to clients and internal partners. Makes recommendations to HRS Managers and other business partners regarding the development of policies and procedures by identifying processing efficiencies and making recommendations on how to implement changes. Ensures all business unit SLA’s are in place, adhered and are updated to meet the ever changing business needs. Acts as the subject matter expert for fulfillment to support product integration and must be able to work with multiple systems due to the scope of products the EPFC supports. Qualifications Associate's Degree - Preferred 2nd Shift, 11:00AM – 8:00PM Monday through Friday at University Park

Under a significant level of guidance and direction, provides customer service for one or more Paychex products. Uses prescribed guidelines to ensure good customer relations are maintained and customer claims and complaints are resolved fairly, effectively, and in accordance with Paychex policies and procedures.   Delivers quality service to Paychex clients for Section 125 Ops Transactions team Follows up on outstanding items to issue completion in compliance with established Service Level Agreements Uses systems and software packages, which may include HRIS, Salesforce, Flex, Core Advanced, and ORS Develops and maintains a basic working knowledge of Paychex S125 products Documents all client interactions, performs data input, maintaining strong prioritization and organization   Customer service and data entry - required HIPAA compliance experience - preferred Health insurance or FSA/HSA benefits experience - preferred Enrollment, claims, transactions experience - preferred

Overview Assembles payroll packages for delivery and performs other fulfillment-related tasks. Responsibilities Assembles payroll packages according to client number and prepares for delivery to clients in order to meet quality and production time line expectations. Packages include journals, summaries, time sheets, tax notices, checks and miscellaneous reports. Operates various types of office equipment (mail metering, shipping PC’s, insertion equipment, etc.) to ensure timely processing of payrolls or client packages. Coordinates and performs timely daily posting of mail and overnight labels to schedules. Completes all package confirmations and checklists in order to maintain accurate tracking and security of package flow and location. Complies with all security and audit procedures as required by procedures and policy in order to protect client information. Records and escalates issues to appropriate parties to ensure that output is not missing or incorrect. Maintains readiness of all distribution equipment including regular cleaning and user maintenance, and coordinates vendor maintenance when required in order to meet production requirements. Stages packaging supplies as necessary in order to maintain production readiness. Performs other duties as assigned, including inventory, assembling quarterly packages, and may include back-up computer operations. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required in Basic Computer Skills - Preferred No Experience Will Train. Highly thorough and dependable. Part Time Hours 1PM-6PM Tuesday and Thursday 11:30am-6PM on Wednesday $15.00 an hour

Responsibilities Initiates, answers, and logs all client calls concerning the General Ledger Reporting Service; performs associated troubleshooting and assists users to maximize client retention, maintain relationships with referring CPAs, and to explain and maintain the integrity of accounting data supplied to clients and CPAs. Supports the General Ledger Reporting Service by fielding inbound calls and making outbound calls to clients and CPAs. May also distribute product information internally to Paychex users. Meets goals for telephone and e-mail response time to ensure quality customer service. Maintains knowledge of payroll and all ancillary products and services in order to assist branch personnel with general ledger and accounting issues. Assists clients and CPAs with entry of new client information into the General Ledger Reporting Service to ensure accuracy. Provides technical expertise regarding internet practices and PC functions in order to assist clients and CPAs with PC-related procedures, including file download, editing files, and import/export functions. Supports clients and CPAs on accounting software such as QuickBooks, Peachtree, Creative Solutions, and Datafaction to assist with import/export, making/deleting transactions, adding to/changing charts of accounts, and other troubleshooting. Proficient in all other supported third-party accounting software packages and Microsoft Excel in order to support clients. Utilizes familiar accounting terminology when speaking with accountants, but is also able to interpret the needs of clients with limited accounting knowledge to ensure that appropriate level of customer service is provided. Manually creates accounting data for clients and CPAs when the system is unavailable to ensure timely receipt of information. Develops, implements, maintains, and administers training programs for all new and current employees to optimize level of effectiveness and ability. Logs phone calls and email in order to build and maintain a database of client and CPA interactions. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Experience as a Paychex Sr. Payroll Specialist. 2 years of experience in Small business accounting utilizing accounting software to perform tasks such as payroll, balancing bank statements, budgeting, and monitoring cash flow.

Diploma - Required Experience as a Paychex Sr. Payroll Specialist. 2 years of experience in Small business accounting utilizing accounting software to perform tasks such as payroll, balancing bank statements, budgeting, and monitoring cash flow.

Overview Initiates, answers, and logs all client calls concerning the General Ledger Reporting Service; performs associated troubleshooting and assists users to maximize client retention, maintain relationships with referring CPAs, and to explain and maintain the integrity of accounting data supplied to clients and CPAs. Responsibilities Supports the General Ledger Reporting Service by fielding inbound calls and making outbound calls to clients and CPAs. May also distribute product information internally to Paychex users. Meets goals for telephone and e-mail response time to ensure quality customer service. Maintains knowledge of payroll and all ancillary products and services in order to assist branch personnel with general ledger and accounting issues. Assists clients and CPAs with entry of new client information into the General Ledger Reporting Service to ensure accuracy. Provides technical expertise regarding internet practices and PC functions in order to assist clients and CPAs with PC-related procedures, including file download, editing files, and import/export functions. Supports clients and CPAs on accounting software such as QuickBooks, Peachtree, Creative Solutions, and Datafaction to assist with import/export, making/deleting transactions, adding to/changing charts of accounts, and other troubleshooting. Proficient in all other supported third-party accounting software packages and Microsoft Excel in order to support clients. Utilizes familiar accounting terminology when speaking with accountants, but is also able to interpret the needs of clients with limited accounting knowledge to ensure that appropriate level of customer service is provided. Manually creates accounting data for clients and CPAs when the system is unavailable to ensure timely receipt of information. Develops, implements, maintains, and administers training programs for all new and current employees to optimize level of effectiveness and ability. Logs phone calls and email in order to build and maintain a database of client and CPA interactions. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Experience as a Paychex Sr. Payroll Specialist. 2 years of experience in Small business accounting utilizing accounting software to perform tasks such as payroll, balancing bank statements, budgeting, and monitoring cash flow.

Overview Manages, monitors and directs all activities, workflow and transactional management of the Regional teams within the Paychex Agency. Responsibilities Communicates expectations to the Regional Team Leaders and reviews process on a quarterly basis to ensure meeting budget and operational priorities. Ensures client satisfaction is met through managing client losses. Assists in the establishment of policies and implements all policies and procedures relating to the workflow of the assigned team to ensure timely and accurate service. Ensures product and department integrity by maintaining compliance with state, federal and insurance carrier guidelines, as well as standards set forth within the Agency, and HRS. Maintains and fosters carrier relationships, including General Agents, to ensure prompt and efficient service to client teams based on follow-up and issue resolution needs. Works with Agency Compliance, carriers and Paychex Legal to ensure Federal/State regulation compliance is achieved and strategic business decisions are implemented. Researches and proposes enhancements to existing products’ operational processes to create efficiencies and maintain service levels. Develops and maintains relationships with Sales, Premier, MMS, Product Management, Operations, IT and Accounting partners to ensure optimal service to clients with minimal breakdowns between internal Paychex teams. Reviews business processes to ensure accuracy, efficiency in productivity measures and adherence to internal and external client service level standards, as well as recommends the necessary changes to maintain a competitive advantage. Recruits, selects, hires and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure all department needs are handled appropriately. Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs and other resources as required for professional advancement. Prepares the capital and operating budgets for the cost center(s) and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost center(s). Achieves cost center projections through labor expense and administrative expense controls. Life, Accident and Health must be obtained within 90 days of employment. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in 2 years of experience in supervisory experience. Life Accident and Health license Life Accident and Health License is preferred for candidates. Employees hired into this position without this license are required to obtain the license within 90 days of employment. - Required

Overview Partners with senior leadership to develop proactive strategies to strengthen culture, productivity, and engagement within the workforce. Responsibilities Builds comprehensive, future focused, people strategies that ensure impactful business outcomes Establishes trusted partnerships with Sr business executives and builds a high level of business acumen Proactively understands external trends and business needs to influence the best people and business results Leverages consultative skills to influence where the business is headed Can successfully manage through ambiguity and change leadership while leading the organization through transformational change Partners with COE’s to deliver HR and Business initiatives that drive effectiveness and efficiency Leads with data and insights to inform decisions and the right solutions Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred Experience supporting multi-site, multi-state organization. 8 years of experience in Generalist experience in human resources. 3 years of experience in people and change leadership/management experience in a dynamic environment. 2 years of experience in Management experience. Demonstrates problem solving skills. Demonstrates analytical skills. Builds and manages effective teams.

jobTitle: HR Services HR Generalist -Western /Central PA and Central/North NJ
jobDescription: Discover Your Passion and Develop Your Expertise. We are looking for a Human Resource Generalist who has expertise in providing integrated HR consultative support to the Paychex HR Services clients. In this role you will… Provide in depth client consultation, which allows you to build a custom service offering based on specific client needs Provide Strategic HR Consultation in areas of employee relations, leave management, workplace investigations, recruitment and compliance related issues. Conduct research, analyze compliance factors and past precedent when developing recommendations for clients. Manage client activities in on-site or virtual visits to create and develop strong business relationships, retain clients, ensure quality service and build revenue. Just some of the reasons why our employees are #Paychexproud. We value your well-being: From health care plans to retirement planning and wellness programs. We value your time: From paid time off, to company holidays as well as comprehensive work-life balance programs. We value your development: Our best-in-class training and development team will provide you with ongoing learning opportunities to give you the building blocks to grow your career at Paychex. We value your perspective: Our company culture reflects the diversity of our employees. We want you to be you. We value our community: We offer paid-time off for volunteerism and promote many company-wide and local initiatives that benefit organizations you care about.       This role is a strong fit if you have… Minimum 2 years HR consultative experience Multi-Site Organizational Knowledge preferred Prior experience in a client-facing position preferred Multi-State Employment Law Knowledge strongly preferred

Overview Manages and directs customer segment team to ensure that quality service is provided to HR Solutions clients. Ensures product revenue growth, profitability, and sales attainment for HR Services product; manages P&L for that book of business, and ensures accurate and timely resolution of HR issues for HR Services division. Responsibilities Builds collaborative partner relationships to deliver the best client experience Ensures HR Partners maintaining knowledge of trends and changes in Human Resources legislation; makes recommendations to clients to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local governmental agencies. Monitors turnover and other employment issues that impact field operations. Designs and implements strategies for improved internal communication and product and process improvement. Recruits, selects, hires, and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure that all departmental needs are handled appropriately. Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs, and other resources. Works with internal sales business partners (i.e., Regional Sales Managers) to ensure common business objectives are being met. Directs team of Area Managers to reinforce strategic performance results regarding revenue, client satisfaction, client retention, team development, and related performance measures. Manages development and implementation of policies and procedures to promote service philosophy and improve staff productivity Evaluates current and future internal training and development needs and secures resources to ensure that needs of end-users are met. Assists Area Managers with development of strategies for clients regarding employee relations, disciplinary measures, operations, and performance issues. Works with internal sales business partners (i.e., Regional Sales Managers) to ensure common business objectives are being met. Works directly with clients as needed. Exhibits strong leadership skills to drive change in the organization as needed as well as to attain business results. Live the Paychex Values: Act with uncompromising integrity. Provide outstanding service and build trusted relationships. Drive innovation in our products and services and continually improve our processes. Work in partnership and support each other. Be personally accountable and deliver on commitments. Treat each other with respect and dignity. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 3 years of experience in management - required Previous experience with management of remote staff - preferred Travel is required 50% of the time At least 10 years of functional HR leadership experience - required

Overview Acts as project manager on behalf of Paychex, BeneTrac and the client during implementation phase. Coordinates efforts of team who are responsible for the client's start up and implementation of BeneTrac software and hardware systems, up to the point where the client has successfully implemented and connected its product suite. Responsibilities Acts as primary contact for the client during the implementation process to resolve issues, answer questions and ensure expectations and deadlines are met. Determines client product needs to ensure client expectations are properly set. Establishes and maintains partnerships with Sales Manager and Sales Representatives to ensure that all new and current client needs are assessed and met. Creates and manages an implementation timeline including all tasks to be completed to ensure a successful client launch. Manages communications and meetings with internal team members to ensure tasks are being completed and deadlines met. Manages changes in project scope, identifies potential risks, and devises contingency plans to ensure client needs are being met. Works closely with Implementation team and Sales to provide outstanding support and product implementation to clients. Provides regular status updates to Implementation Supervisor/Manager and Sales to ensure all necessary tasks are being completed. Ensures all end-user documentation is complete and delivered to client, allowing client to effectively utilize product(s). Performs a professional and thorough transition of the client to the Ongoing Support Team to finalize implementation phase. Makes recommendations regarding needs analysis and process improvements for implementation team. May provide or oversee client training to ensure client expectations are met. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in Implementation Coordination experience. Ability to build strong customer relationships.

Overview Acts as project manager on behalf of Paychex, BeneTrac and the client during implementation phase. Coordinates efforts of team who are responsible for the client's start up and implementation of BeneTrac software and hardware systems, up to the point where the client has successfully implemented and connected its product suite. Responsibilities Acts as primary contact for the client during the implementation process to resolve issues, answer questions and ensure expectations and deadlines are met. Determines client product needs to ensure client expectations are properly set. Establishes and maintains partnerships with Sales Manager and Sales Representatives to ensure that all new and current client needs are assessed and met. Creates and manages an implementation timeline including all tasks to be completed to ensure a successful client launch. Manages communications and meetings with internal team members to ensure tasks are being completed and deadlines met. Manages changes in project scope, identifies potential risks, and devises contingency plans to ensure client needs are being met. Works closely with Implementation team and Sales to provide outstanding support and product implementation to clients. Provides regular status updates to Implementation Supervisor/Manager and Sales to ensure all necessary tasks are being completed. Ensures all end-user documentation is complete and delivered to client, allowing client to effectively utilize product(s). Performs a professional and thorough transition of the client to the Ongoing Support Team to finalize implementation phase. Makes recommendations regarding needs analysis and process improvements for implementation team. May provide or oversee client training to ensure client expectations are met. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in Implementation Coordination experience. Ability to build strong customer relationships.
