Overview Acts independently to plan and execute advanced data analytics projects and initiatives that may have a strategic impact on Paychex. Serves in a leadership role, managing the processes and tasks of other individuals on the team. Interacts with Directors and/or Vice Presidents, both within and outside of Finance, in the completion of projects and participates on and influences cross-functional teams. Acts as a subject matter expert within specific responsibility area(s). Responsibilities Leads and executes all phases of quantitative research projects by identifying the business problem, conducting data exploration, modeling and communication of final results to leadership across the company to create insightful analytical results that drive strategic decision making in the company. Utilizes financial and operational systems to retrieve and analyze data, perform complex research, interpret findings that have financial impact and draw appropriate conclusions, and develop and publish financial reports to support business unit decisions and performance results. Utilizes advanced functionality of Microsoft Office SQL, VBA, Alteryx, SSIS and/or Business Objects to perform data mining and automation. Extracts and houses data from internal Paychex systems for use in strategic analysis. Builds and designs visual tools such as dashboards to assist management in quickly understanding current business trends. Leads team members in completion of projects and initiatives, providing oversight throughout the engagement and guidance to task completion. Involved in significant company initiatives which may include product and system development, implementation of new business processes or control enhancements, and performance of due diligence procedures for acquired companies. Functions as a subject matter expert in position specific processes and/or responsibility areas. Develops collaborative working relationships with all business partners to ensure a high level of utilization of team services for departmental needs. Meets regularly with the leadership team, including Officers, to report status of reporting requests, present analysis results, and to discuss opportunities for improvements within operations. Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs. Pay range for US Colorado & NYC candidates only: $72k - $100k plus RSUs Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required Master's Degree - Preferred 6 years of experience in Data warehousing, data mining, or analytical environment. Experience with SQL, VBA, or Business Objects. Technical experience with databases and data warehousing concept/tools and proven capability to strategically problem-solve using advanced quantitative and analytical skills.

Overview Responsible for responding to concerns, including investigations, pertaining to workplace policies, procedures and compliance with all company and external requirements in an effort to reduce company-wide risk and contribute to productivity, motivation, and morale, while instilling and maintaining our culture and values. Makes recommendations and implements proactive employee relations strategies and initiatives to drive employee retention and engagement. Responsibilities Provides employee relations services support to management and employees across the organization, driving the development and implementation of creative and compliant solutions to various employee relations issues. Conducts investigations on work-related matters to document findings and make recommendations on appropriate actions. Coaches leaders on the disciplinary process and preparation of performance improvement action plans and/or disciplinary records. Provides coaching, development, and training to business leaders to ensure positive employee relations and communications consistent with company values and work environment expectations. Works with legal counsel on issue resolution to ensure risk mitigation, consistent application across the company and litigation preparation. Serves as active participant on HR/OD Strategic Initiatives or team projects in order to drive improved business results through increased productivity, retention and engagement of the workforce. Assists in designing and delivering training sessions to leaders in performance management and discipline topics to increase leadership competency in this area. Other duties as assigned to support the general purpose of the position’s function. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in HR or business related field. 1 year of experience in Employee relations. 5 years of experience in Human Resources.

Overview Works independently to complete advanced financial analysis assignments that may have a strategic impact on Paychex. Acts as a subject matter expert within specific responsibility area(s). Serves in a leadership role, managing processes and may manage tasks of other financial personnel on the team. Interacts with Directors and/or Vice Presidents within and outside of Finance in the completion of projects and participates on and influences cross-functional teams regarding financial planning and reporting. Responsibilities Supports the Financial Planning & Analysis process for designated areas/functions including preparation of the annual financial plan, periodic forecasts, and monthly variance analysis of actuals compared to plan and forecasts to monitor business performance and ensure appropriate targets are achieved. Utilizes financial systems to retrieve and analyze data, perform complex research, interpret findings that have financial impact and draw appropriate conclusions, and develop and publish financial reports to support business unit decisions and performance results. Supervises other team members in the completion of analysis assignments to provide oversight to work processes and guide to task completion. Serves a lead role in training finance staff including provide guidance, review and finalize analysis and reports to ensure staff comfort in executing tasks and responsibilities. Leads or contributes to cross-functional projects with high visibility and a focus on strategic impact to provide financial consultation to internal stakeholders. Functions as a subject matter expert in position specific processes and/or responsibility areas to provide partnership to assigned business units. Maintains relationships with designated Directors and/or Vice Presidents to provide appropriate financial reporting and guidance for decisions leading to favorable financial outcomes. Creates procedures and processes, and reviews those created by others, to ensure integrity of financial data in analyses and reports. Completes reconciliations of financial data in problem solving and maintenance of financial systems to ensure data integrity. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business 4 years of experience in Related field.

Responsibilities Provides direction, guidance, support, and development to the Enterprise Service team in order to deliver on our service promise to be a proactive partner and earn the mid-market clients' business for life. Works with leadership of product specialists to attain established business targets including profitability, client retention, and growth. Participates in the creation of Enterprise Service strategies and operating practices to ensure that Paychex standards of client service are met or exceeded. Implements continuous process improvement, including adaptation of technologies, to effectively support the multi-product service model. Drives and supports upsell initiatives by identifying client needs and offering product solutions that help the client succeed Manages the Enterprise Service team and executes strategies to ensure client needs are met and business targets are achieved. Recruits, selects, hires and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure all department needs are handled appropriately. Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs and other resources as required for professional development. Creates and fosters an environment that leads to a highly engaged and productive workforce. Leads the Enterprise Service team to achieve client satisfaction and retention goals using key metrics to measure performance. Works with leadership team to monitor key performance indicators and implements corrective measures to ensure achievement of organizational objectives within designated budget. Partners with cross functional business units to ensure that processes support expansion of product suite, attainment of revenue targets, retention of existing clients, management of client discounts, and maintenance of quality service standards. Oversees the implementation of continuous process improvement strategies, including adaptation of technologies, in order for the Enterprise Service team to effectively support the multi-product service model. Manages and maintains relationships/partnerships with implementation, corporate partners, sales, and clients in order to achieve client needs while meeting organizational goals. Responsible for driving and supporting upsell initiatives with service providers by identifying client needs and offering product solutions that help them succeed and enable Paychex to earn their business for life. Participates in the preparation of the capital and operating budgets for the cost center(s) and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost center(s). Achieves cost center projections through labor expense and administrative expense controls. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required 10+ years of experience in Business Environment. 3 years of experience in Leadership. Proficient in English written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrates customer service skills. Ability to build strong customer relationships.

Counsels and develops staff for personal and corporate advancement through career development, training programs and other resources as required for professional development. Creates and fosters an environment that leads to a highly engaged and productive workforce. Leads the Enterprise Service team to achieve client satisfaction and retention goals using key metrics to measure performance. Works with leadership team to monitor key performance indicators and implements corrective measures to ensure achievement of organizational objectives within designated budget. Partners with cross functional business units to ensure that processes support expansion of product suite, attainment of revenue targets, retention of existing clients, management of client discounts, and maintenance of quality service standards. Oversees the implementation of continuous process improvement strategies, including adaptation of technologies, in order for the Enterprise Service team to effectively support the multi-product service model. Manages and maintains relationships/partnerships with implementation, corporate partners, sales, and clients in order to achieve client needs while meeting organizational goals. Responsible for driving and supporting upsell initiatives with service providers by identifying client needs and offering product solutions that help them succeed and enable Paychex to earn their business for life. Participates in the preparation of the capital and operating budgets for the cost center(s) and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost center(s). Achieves cost center projections through labor expense and administrative expense controls. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required 10+ years of experience in Business Environment. 3 years of experience in Leadership. Proficient in English written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrates customer service skills. Ability to build strong customer relationships.

jobTitle: Sr Manager, H&B Service and Retention
jobDescription: Overview Leads and manages Health and Benefits client retention teams. The role is responsible for defining and implementing business strategies and initiatives designed to deliver and ensure superior customer service to H&B clients and client employees. Responsible for managing and exceeding key business metrics including client retention, operating margin, and revenue growth. Responsibilities Responsible for delivering the H&B value proposition to H&B clients including via centralized account management and remote account management teams. Interacts directly with ‘key’ clients to ensure service delivery expectations are being met, assesses the competitive landscape, and adopt service delivery to maximize client retention. Participates in defining new and modified business strategies to improve the retention of clients, the generation of incremental revenue, and improved processes to reduce expense. Ensures client satisfaction is met through the oversight of key service delivery teams and monitoring key management reports. Assists in the establishment of policies and implements all policies and procedures. Defines and supports revenue growth through increased attachment of additional lines of insurance coverage, sales partnership initiatives, and the expansion of insurance products available for sale. Ensures product and department integrity by maintaining compliance with state, federal and insurance carrier guidelines, as well as standards set forth within the Agency. Maintains and fosters external partner relationships, including insurance carriers, general agents, and third party service providers including participating in due diligence exercises and contract negotiations. Works with Agency Compliance, carriers and Paychex Legal to ensure Federal/State regulation compliance is achieved and strategic business decisions are implemented. Allocates staff resources efficiently to maximize customer service, retention, and operating margins. Develops and maintains relationships with key members of senior management within H&B Sales, HR Solutions, MMS, Product Management, Operations, IT and Accounting to ensure optimal service to clients with minimal breakdowns between internal Paychex teams. Recruits, selects, hires and evaluates performance of personnel to ensure all department goals are achieved. Responsible for staff development including defining advancement / career development opportunities, training programs and other resources as required for professional advancement. Prepares and participates in the development of H&B operating budgets including the definition of retention and revenue generation strategies for the cost center(s) and analyzes interdepartmental reports as they relate to the cost center(s). Achieves all cost center planned objectives through the delivery of superior customer service, revenue generation, and expense controls. Qualifications Associate's Degree - Preferred 10+ years of experience in Customer service, account management, or benefits consulting. 3 years of experience in Management. Previous experience managing staff in an account management service model (book of business) and customer service business to business environment. Life Accident and Health license Life Accident and Health License is preferred for candidates. Employees hired into this position without this license are required to obtain the license within 90 days of employment. - Required

Manages a team of System Development Managers (I&II). Responsible for the strategic direction for their application stack, including on-time delivery, quality, system performance and overall availability.   Responsible for application design, availability, performance, health, and quality. Lobbies with Product Owner to ensure these items are prioritized correctly. Ownership of understanding of the user experience in their respective applications areas from a performance, availability, processing windows, and errors perspective. Is a key partner with Operational and Product Leadership to provide technical direction and solutions. Responsible for the overall test strategy of the application (automation, regression, performance). Works with Release Engineer to drive Continuous Delivery principles for build, deploy and release. Partners with the Architecture Team to ensure system design is inclusive of the full infrastructure/software stack. Partners with Product Owners, Architecture, and the Program Team to help drive the process of qualifying the work and ensuring that the solutions developed are in line with the future product strategy. Experienced in developing the long-term strategy for technology platforms that translate into an achievable roadmap. General management responsibilities for a team of Systems Development Managers, including: Conducts one-on-ones to ensure positive growth, attitude and well-being of each individual. Facilitates performance evaluations based on team and individual performance, team feedback and goal achievement. Manages the management team by continually managing the weakest performers up, or out of the organization. Guides team members to determine appropriate personal development goals and plan for execution. Mentors and coaches team members to improve areas of expertise, interpersonal skills, team collaboration skills, etc. Provides oversight and direction for all application development and testing teams within a Program. Assess team performance through observation in release planning meetings, stand-ups and demos. Course correct the team by providing coaching and guidance through the scrum master and solution lead as necessary. May lead or participate in a Community of Practice (CoP), as needed. Is accountable for performance and cohesion of team in collaboration with the program team. Monitors team performance against success criteria. Hold 1-1’s with Program and Product Managers team member performance feedback Provides the team with technology/collaboration tools/training they need. Understands the current work in progress, availability of the teams, skillsets and subject matter expertise to ensure that future work is placed into the backlog for the appropriate team. Participates as contributing member of Program or Portfolio Leadership Team. Experienced in scoping and justifying resources and budget needs to senior leaders and finance partners. Participates in third party vendor discussions, RFPs, SOWs and contract negotiations. Displays a broader set of leadership skills participating outside of their area of expertise in enterprise wide initiatives to achieve IT goals. Acts as Subject Matter Expert (SME) to teams as needed based on technology/application knowledge. Recommends process improvement changes to drive efficiency, productivity and quality Participates in cross cutting discussions technology and process discussions outside of their area of expertise. Participates in third party vendor discussions, RFPs, SOWs and contract negotiations   Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/MIS - Preferred 5 years of experience in Development manager.

Overview The Senior Product Strategy Manager is responsible for developing product strategy and overall product experience for our Business Insurance product lines. This person will be responsible for driving vision and identifies functionality requirements needed to excel in a competitive marketplace. Responsibilities Identifies and develops product strategy for high impact opportunities and drives product vision, strategy, roadmap, and features, including keeping up on business changes and trends impacting the users, external benchmarking and incorporation of BI technologies trends. Manages the overall customer experience, including the technical, functional, process, and policy considerations. Creatively defines and implements solutions to those challenges. Establishes and manages strategic relationships with Paychex officers and key business partners to assist in the development of marketing strategies and to improve the product line efficiency and effectiveness. Monetizes and deploys strategy based on benchmarking, customer feedback, data from competitors, and market trends for new and existing products and services Work with stakeholders to create strategic and tactical plans to address inhibitors to product performance. Evaluates product launch post-deployment and create/oversee plan corrections. Respond to escalations based on feedback from key stakeholders. Conduct partnership meetings with Sales, Service, Marketing, and Client Experience. Prepare board and executive product updates and create product talking points for analyst calls. Monitor compliance environment and make product recommendations for implementing regulation. May manage managers or individual contributors based on product scope. Serves as product management expert and mentors team members. Qualifications Property and Casualty insurance industry experience - required. Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or equivalent experience required. Master's Degree in Business Administration or equivalent experience preferred. Demonstrates analytical skills. Strong verbal communication and listening skills. Strong presentation skills and experince presenting to the C-Suite. 10+ years of experience in Product Management Location Specific Compensation $130-215,000 plus bonus with RSU's. Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.

Overview Guides client through the unemployment hearing process and serves as a client representative. Responsibilities Prepares clients for unemployment hearings to ensure that the client is knowledgeable on the process and that all appropriate information has been gathered. Serves as client representative in unemployment hearings to ensure that the client is best represented and the claim is adjudicated effectively and in the best interest of the client. Researches and provides problem analysis for escalated issues to promote customer service and ensure accuracy of information. Mentors and trains SUI Client Maintenance Specialists and SUI Claim Specialists to provide direction and assistance on daily tasks and responsibilities and to increase knowledge and understanding of departmental processes and unemployment insurance regulations. Analyzes annual tax rate notices on behalf of clients to ensure accuracy of information and appropriateness of tax rate. Participates in projects and departmental initiatives; identifies training, documentation, and system enhancement needs and addresses them to improve departmental processes and efficiencies. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Associate's Degree - Preferred Knowledge of Unemployment process or experience within a legal setting a plus.

Overview Supervises and directs Dedicated Service Center staff who support various Paychex platforms. Manages and coordinates daily operational activities to ensure efficient and effective service levels to support departmental standards and goals. Provides leadership and technical advice on multiple product lines in order to resolve problems. Establishes and maintains positive image with clients and Payroll Specialists. Responsibilities Supervises and schedules staff to ensure outstanding quality client service and timely resolution of client issues and escalations. Facilitates and executes requests such as procedural exceptions to ensure timely resolution, and minimizes the risks associated with exception handling. Responsible for responding and resolving Service related feedback via Social Media. Provides technical support for all payroll platforms to resolve client concerns and enforce Paychex policies and procedures. Collaborates with regional and corporate personnel to identify and resolve system problems. Plans, coordinates, and organizes data integrity and quarter/year-end processes to provide accurate and timely tax documents to clients. Coordinates communications to outside parties, including field offices and corporate departments, to ensure compliance with guidelines. Maintains knowledge of changes in payroll laws and Paychex policies and procedures to further personal and professional development. In conjunction with Training and Development partners, supervises training of personnel and recommends, implements, and monitors on-the-job training and education to further professional advancement and overall value of assigned personnel. Identifies training, documentation, and system enhancement needs and coordinates the appropriate resolution to ensure the evolution of process, product and personnel. Assists the Manager with development of Dedicated Service Center goals and improvement strategies to achieve center operational objectives. Makes recommendations and proposals for departmental operations and administrative process improvements. Participates in projects and departmental initiatives as needed to ensure continual product and process improvement. Acts as the focal point for recruiting activities related to sourcing, interviewing and hiring to ensure that the best possible talent is acquired. Evaluates performance, recommends merit increases, promotion, termination, and disciplinary action to maximize team/branch performance. May act independently of Manager. Assist manager with development of operating budgets, particularly with personnel requirements to ensure that staff levels are within corporate metrics. Tracks and reports statistics such as, processing volumes, audit controls, processing times, etc. to the leadership team to help them evaluate performance against goals and metrics. Other duties as assigned to support the general purpose of the position’s function. Qualifications H.S. Diploma - Required Knowledge and/or experience in benefits and/or payroll. 3 years of experience in Related field. 2 years of experience in Supervisory experience including demonstrated leadership skills.

Overview Responsible for departmental objectives, supervising processes and resolution of escalated issues, including annual enrollment and monthly eligibility process for all clients and worksite employees. Responsibilities Supervises group of direct reports; completes performance reviews, monthly one-on-ones, team meetings, new employee training, team-building activities, guidance, and disciplinary action. Supervises group responsible for carrier discrepancies, COBRA compliance, Section 125 compliance, HAS administration, H&B online resolution, and internal payroll. Supervises and oversees annual enrollment process with other departmental supervisors and department manager including monitoring, reporting, updates, and related reports for rate, new plan setup, and expense tracking. Maintains high level of job, industry, and benefit plan knowledge. Participates in joint decision-making with other departmental supervisors on issues affecting direct reports, processes, and procedures. Ensures that customer service standards are communicated to benefits specialists, including training, auditing, and monitoring of procedures. Oversees monthly eligibility process, including developing and distributing new plan packets. Analyzes and implements process improvements. Fields escalated client calls; researches and resolves client issues to meet client expectations. Participates in departmental and branch-wide projects. Reviews and approves financial reconciliations (adjustments and monthly audits). Communicates with carriers to answer questions from clients, client-employees, benefits specialists, Human Resource Generalists, sales representatives, and managers. Qualifications Associate's Degree - Preferred 1 year of experience in Leadership role. 1 year of experience in Paychex experience. Effective leadership skills. Effective leadership skills.
location: West Palm Beach, Florida, Estados Unidos

jobDescription: Overview The Supplier Relationship Manager is responsible for establishing and managing relationships with qualified suppliers and monitoring supplier performance. Partners with internal cross-functional teams to establish and maintain relationships with suppliers to ensure Paychex operates in a strategic and goal-oriented manner. Responsible for the oversight, management, and reporting of supply chain risk activities. Works with key internal stockholders to develop and execute risk mitigation strategies throughout the supply chain. Responsibilities Establishes strong, collaborative relationships with key internal and external stakeholders to strategically develop, implement and optimize supplier management processes, tools, and policies to achieve performance objectives and mitigate risk. Determines and leads supplier ongoing monitoring plan with cross-functional teams with focus on business reviews, issue management reviews, performance score carding, contract management reviews, risk management reviews, etc. Identifies and tracks industry trends relating to supplier programs, financial and/or compliance risks, program issues that are impacting supplier services from achieving performance goals and present resolution and improvement opportunities. Mitigates supply chain risk through supplier qualification, development, and alternatives. Develops, prepares and communicates supplier performance metrics, evaluation criteria, and scorecard results. Prepares and executes bid packages utilizing Request for Information (RFI), Request for Proposal (RFP), Request for Quote (RFQ), etc. to meet criteria of pricing, quality, quantity, availability, and delivery dates. Performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business, Supply Chain, Procurement - Preferred 5 years of experience in Related field. Excellent collaboration and team building skills. Strong verbal communication and listening skills. Ability to influence internal and/or external constituents. Ability to analyze and interpret financial data. Effective negotiation skills.

System Engineer II   A seasoned position requiring in-depth knowledge and experience in compute system technologies. Works independently under moderate supervision responsible for troubleshooting, installing, configuring, and maintaining server hardware, operating systems, and applications in support of business requirements. Provides technical support during critical and non-critical business hours. Proactively identifies and automates the resolution to availability and performance issues throughout the environment.This position will expose the candidate to all server based operating systems (Linux, Windows) at Paychex and will require the development of skills to support, administer, and engineer cross-platform OS solutions. The candidate will be exposed to Continuous Delivery concepts such as Version Control, Continuous Integration, Testing (smoke, sanity, regression), Automation, and Orchestration as a means to deliver and support IT systems at Paychex. Technologies like Git, Artifactory, ServerSpec, Puppet, Ansible, and many more are the means to achieve our organizations 'as code' goals and objectives. Scripting (Bash, Powershell), and non-scripting (Ruby, Python, Go) languages are leveraged to extend features/functionality within our current toolsets and further our self-service, automation, and orchestration capabilities and services. The candidate will leverage the latest technologies from Cisco, Dell/EMC, Docker, Google, Microsoft, Red Hat, VMware, and many Open Source projects in our IT environment that are critical to delivering Paychex's IT infrastructure services. The candidate will be integrated into DevOps teams (Delivery Teams) with Software Developers and Testers, Build and Release Engineers, Solution Leads, Scrum Masters, and many more, responsible for delivering new products, features/functionality, and remediating defects for Paychex's Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions. Provides moderately complex technical support during critical and non-critical business hours on server hardware, operating systems, and software. Is proactive and reactive for problem alerting, analysis, resolution, and follow up to ensure platform stability. Deploys and configuring moderately complex server operating systems and applications (Corporate and Third-Party) in physical, virtual, and containerized compute environments to corporate and vendor standards. Performs moderately complex application and storage system upgrades (hardware/software) as well as periodic health checks in accordance with established corporate policies and procedures. Supports cross-functional project teams to help deliver solutions as required. Creates and maintains technical reference documentation to be used in support and training of Information Technology (IT) personnel. Proactively identifies and automates the resolution to availability and performance failures throughout the environment. Proactively identifies work requests that can be downshifted to Operations staff or automated via software automation and orchestration tools. Ensures that all working knowledge sets are properly documented and communicated. Participates in the creation of corporate standards, best practices, and roadmaps for IT systems and technologies. Participates in the creation of designs for corporate IT systems.   Associate's Degree in Computer related discipline and/or an IT certification in an applicable field - Preferred 4 years of experience in Infrastructure administration or support role. Applicant should have experience in IT systems administration and process management."

Overview The Talent Pipeline Consultant serves as a strategic partner to senior business leaders on future-focused talent pipeline needs and solutions. Working closely with People Strategy Partners, combines the latest thought and practice leadership to the enterprise to derive insights and shape talent recommendations. Drives talent processes and related activities. Participates in the generation of talent development strategies HR strategic objectives. Responsibilities Understands complex business priorities, opportunities and challenges, and external influencing factors. Consults with executives on internal/external talent sourcing mix, aligning to a common set of cultural and business needs. Designs and executes strategic and comprehensive talent initiatives to effectively identify, qualify, and retain talent to meet current and projected needs of the organization. Drives the continual improvement of the talent assessment process to ensure consistency and the voice of the client into future efforts. Leverages data and needs analyses, fosters diagnostic thinking and appropriate expectations. Facilitates standardized talent calibration processes/sessions with senior leader client teams to ensure consistency among all assessed employees. Holds one’s own amid strong opinions, facilitating open and honest dialog to achieve desired outcomes. Consults with business leaders on succession and bench planning. Makes recommendations and provides expert guidance and expertise. Supports leader transitions to new, expanded, or rotational roles, ensuring a positive and constructive experience. Facilitates New Manager Assimilation sessions to effectively acclimate managers to their team and Paychex, and to initiate more effective organizational communication. Recommends high-potential leader mobility processes, resources, and movement based on business sponsorship. Partners with internal and external providers to help build a talented, equitable and diverse workforce. Participates in the development and upgrade of measurements and metrics to drive talent management effectiveness. Maintains a high degree of effective communication with HR partners regarding their client teams to ensure a singular approach. Participates in the development and implementation of leadership strategy to ensure a global client perspective is incorporated in planning efforts. Partners to outline workforce leadership needs to assist functional clients in assessing leadership pipeline. Leads HR project teams and cross-functional teams to drive HR strategic objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required 10+ years of experience in Related field. 10+ years of experience in Leadership or management training. 10+ years of experience in Organizational development, coaching, organizational behavior, and facilitation. Experience working in an HRBP/COE environment.

Recommends high-potential leader mobility processes, resources, and movement based on business sponsorship. Partners with internal and external providers to help build a talented, equitable and diverse workforce. Participates in the development and upgrade of measurements and metrics to drive talent management effectiveness. Maintains a high degree of effective communication with HR partners regarding their client teams to ensure a singular approach. Participates in the development and implementation of leadership strategy to ensure a global client perspective is incorporated in planning efforts. Partners to outline workforce leadership needs to assist functional clients in assessing leadership pipeline. Leads HR project teams and cross-functional teams to drive HR strategic objectives. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree - Required 10+ years of experience in Related field. 10+ years of experience in Leadership or management training. 10+ years of experience in Organizational development, coaching, organizational behavior, and facilitation. Experience working in an HRBP/COE environment.

Overview The User Experience Design Lead establishes and drives adoption of processes and methodologies to achieve the UX Strategy. In this role, you will be involved in every step of design, including research, ideation, mapping user flows, prototyping, creating mockups, and designing high-fidelity UIs. You will identify areas of need for design direction, lead user-focused thinking across product portfolios, and conduct and lead design reviews with designers at key project milestones, and steward projects into best-in-class experiences. You will guide projects to align with documented goals by empowering the UX team to drive innovative approaches. Responsibilities Identify areas of need for design direction and thought leadership across product portfolios Bring clarity to a project with a design-thinking approach (e.g., affinity diagrams, user journeys, task flow diagrams, personas) Partner with product management, user research, content strategists, and developers to creatively solve user needs Lead planning activities, leveraging quantitative and qualitative research data to inspire product experiences that delight users Oversee UX research and design for up to 6-10 projects, with oversight of 4-6 designers. Includes coordination of usability testing activities and review/approval of deliverables crafted by other designers Ensure adherence to design best practices, our standards, and UX strategy Mentor and coach designers. Proactively help other designers level up their craft expertise Serve as a culture champion, modeling high standards of the UX craft and living Paychex values Sketch, wireframe, and create mockups and prototypes using Figma Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Visual, Motion, Interaction, Information Architecture, HCI - Required 5 years of experience in Professional product design experience, preferably working on B2B applications. Portfolio that showcases exceptional design, highlighting process and methods used to solve real-world problems. Experience working with design systems or pattern libraries. 2 years of experience in Experience leading complex design projects in a team lead role. Location Specific Compensation $110,000 - $130,000 + RSU. Benefits offered to employees include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Family Leave, Life Insurance, 401(k) Retirement, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Holidays, Vacation and Sick days. You will also have access to Tuition Reimbursement and our award winning and best in class Employee Well-being and Training programs.
